description: Gateway Classic Cars of Chicago is proud to present a classic icon of American automotive history, the 1957 Chevrolet Bel Air. This stunning vehicle is a testament to the golden era of car design, featuring a striking red exterior that captures attention and admiration wherever it goes. The vibrant hue is complemented by a matching red interior, creating a stylish aesthetic. Under the hood, this Bel Air is powered by a robust V8 engine, delivering the performance and power that enthusiasts have cherished for decades. Paired with a manual transmission, this vehicle offers an engaging driving experience that connects the driver to the road in a way that only a classic car can. Inside, the vehicle is equipped with a range of features designed to enhance comfort and convenience. The air conditioning system ensures a pleasant cabin environment, allowing you to enjoy the ride in comfort regardless of the weather outside. Power brakes and power steering provide ease of handling, making driving this classic car a smooth and enjoyable experience. The inclusion of power seats adds an element of luxury, allowing for effortless adjustments to find a good driving position. The interior of the Bel Air is adorned with durable vinyl, offering a practical yet stylish finish that complements the overall design. A tilt steering wheel is also featured, providing additional comfort and customization for the driver. Whether you're a collector or simply an admirer of classic cars, this Bel Air is sure to impress with its iconic design and thoughtful features. For more information, contact our Chicago showroom at (708) 444-4488 and be sure to check out our website with 100+ HD pictures and videos at GatewayClassicCars.com First Name Please provide a first name. Gateway Classic Cars of San Antonio/Austin is excited to present this 1959 Chevrolet Impala. Finished in a crisp white exterior over a fully custom red leather interior, this Impala blends the unmistakable style of the late 1950s with modern performance and craftsmanship. Powering this build is a 6.2L V8 engine paired with a 4L60E automatic transmission, producing an estimated 500 horsepower as stated by the seller. The car underwent a four-year restoration, resulting in a striking combination of vintage design and updated engineering. This Impala features a range of performance upgrades and custom touches. It's equipped with an electronic air ride suspension for adjustable ride height and comfort, a 9-inch rear end, and a custom engine bay featuring a Champion Cooling aluminum radiator, Holley EFI, Hedman Hussler headers, and a Tru Trac air conditioning system. CPP power brakes and power steering provide modern drivability and confident control behind the wheel. The exterior retains much of its original charm, highlighted by original chrome as stated by the seller and refinished stainless steel that complement the clean body lines. It rides on Billet Specialties aluminum wheels wrapped in distinctive red sidewall performance tires that tie in beautifully with the car's interior color scheme. Inside, the Impala showcases a fully custom red leather interior and matching trunk upholstery, offering a cohesive and luxurious presentation. Power windows, air conditioning, and an AM/FM radio add comfort and convenience for cruising. This 1959 Chevrolet Impala represents a blend of classic American design and modern performance. With its detailed restoration, custom craftsmanship, and an estimated 500 horsepower stated by the seller, it stands as a remarkable interpretation of one of Chevrolet's most iconic models. Gateway Classic Cars of San Antonio/Austin is excited to present this 1963 Ford Falcon. Finished in a sleek black exterior with a striking red interior, this Falcon is said to be a no-expense-spared custom build that blends classic Ford styling with serious performance upgrades. Under the hood, it's said to feature Ford's legendary 427 cubic inch SOHC "Cammer" V8 engine-an aluminum powerplant reportedly rated for 1000 horsepower but said to produce around 700 horsepower as it sits. Power is delivered through a C4 3-speed automatic transmission, offering smooth operation and precise control. Said to be built by Barillaro Speed Emporium, this Falcon's 427 engine reportedly includes an all-new aluminum block, heads, crank, and connecting rods, paired with dual Holley 600 CFM 4-barrel carburetors mounted on an aluminum intake manifold. Supporting components include an MSD distributor, blaster coil, and ignition wires for reliable spark delivery. Cooling is handled by a Be Cool aluminum radiator with twin electric fans, ensuring optimal temperature control during performance driving. This Falcon is said to feature a custom-built front A-arm and 4-link rear suspension with adjustable coilovers, complemented by Wilwood disc brakes on all four corners. Power is transferred through a Detroit Locker rear end, while the back end has been tubbed to accommodate wide Mickey Thompson Street S tires. Up front, it rides on Yokohama Avid tires, and all four corners feature custom Sprint aluminum wheels that enhance both stance and style. Inside, the red interior offers a purposeful and classic look with bucket seats, a Grant steering wheel, and a Hurst shifter. The cabin also includes seatbelts, a tilt steering wheel, and an AM radio for a period-correct touch. Exterior details include rechromed grille, headlight, and taillight bezels, adding a refined finish to this custom performance machine. This 1963 Ford Falcon represents a striking blend of craftsmanship, engineering, and heritage, said to be built with exceptional attention to detail and performance in mind. Introducing a classic gem that embodies the spirit of the 1960s: the 1964 Chevrolet Malibu. This iconic vehicle is a testament to timeless design and American automotive craftsmanship. With its striking Meadow Green exterior, this Malibu captures attention and admiration wherever it goes. The vibrant color is complemented by a sleek black leather interior, offering a sophisticated and comfortable driving experience. One improvement made was the addition of custom aluminum trim on the roof. Under the hood, this Malibu is powered a 383ci small block stroker engine from BluePrint Engine backed by a 700R4 transmission to utilize an overdrive gear in combination with a Currie 9-inch rear end. It rides on a installed a QA1 coil-over suspension system. The vehicle is equipped with a range of features designed to enhance your driving pleasure. Enjoy the comfort of air conditioning, ensuring a pleasant journey in any weather. For entertainment on the road, a RetroSound head unit with JL Audio speakers was added. The original column was adapted to the auto trans, and Dakota Digital gauges replaced the originals. A set of 178-inch U.S. Mags Rambler wheels was installed. The performance tires ensure optimal traction and handling, making every drive a delight. Safety and convenience are prioritized with features such as power brakes and power steering, providing ease of control and peace of mind. The inclusion of radial tires further enhances the vehicle's stability and performance. Inside, the black leather interior offers a luxurious and inviting atmosphere. The seats are equipped with seatbelts, reflecting a commitment to safety. This 1964 Chevrolet Malibu is a remarkable blend of style, performance, and comfort, making it a standout choice for those who appreciate classic cars with modern conveniences. Whether you're a collector or simply someone who appreciates the beauty of vintage automobiles, this Malibu is sure to impress. First Name Please provide a first name. Gateway Classic Cars of Charlotte is proud to digitally to present this stunning 1965 Ford Mustang GT350 Tribute, a true homage to the iconic muscle car era, boasting an eye-catching Calypso Coral exterior that is sure to turn heads wherever it goes. This classic beauty is powered by a robust 302 Windsor V8 engine, superbly paired with a 5-speed manual transmission, offering an exhilarating driving experience that captures the essence of American automotive history. Step inside to find a sleek black interior that complements the vibrant exterior. The cabin is equipped with modern conveniences such as air conditioning, ensuring comfort on those warm cruising days. The AM/FM radio provides entertainment for your journeys, while the vinyl interior and tilt steering wheel add to the car's classic charm and driving pleasure. This Mustang GT350 Tribute is not just about looks and performance; it also features custom wheels and radial tires that enhance its road presence and handling. Safety is addressed with power brakes and seatbelts, providing peace of mind as you enjoy the ride. The 389:1 gear ratio further enhances the driving dynamics, making this car a joy to drive on both city streets and open highways. Having been showcased in 11 car shows, this Mustang has garnered several awards, a testament to its appeal and the admiration it commands among enthusiasts and judges alike. Whether you're a collector or a classic car enthusiast, this 1965 Ford Mustang GT350 Tribute offers a unique opportunity to own a piece of automotive history that combines classic style with modern features. Gateway Classic Cars of Las Vegas is excited to digitally present this iconic 1969 Chevrolet Camaro RS, a classic masterpiece that seamlessly blends vintage charm with modern performance enhancements. This striking vehicle boasts a sleek black exterior that exudes timeless elegance, complemented by a sophisticated black interior. Under the hood lies a powerful LS3 supercharged V8 engine, delivering an exhilarating driving experience that is further enhanced by an overdrive 4L80 automatic transmission. This combination ensures a smooth and responsive ride, making every journey a memorable one. Inside, the Camaro RS offers a range of features designed to enhance comfort and convenience. The air conditioning system provides a refreshing atmosphere, ensuring a pleasant drive regardless of the weather. The TMI leather interior adds a touch of classic style, while the tilt steering wheel allows for personalized comfort and control. Modern amenities such as power windows, power locks, and power steering offer ease of use, making this classic car a joy to drive. The car features a LS3 6.2L packaged with a Vortec V3 SC1 blower! TMI custom seats, 18" wheels and tires, 4 link suspension with adjustable coil over suspension and flow master exhaust this this has all the GO you want and the WOAH on the other side is handled by Wilwood brake. The exterior of the Camaro RS is equipped with 18" aluminum wheels and performance tires, providing both aesthetic appeal and enhanced road handling capabilities. Safety is also a priority, with features like power brakes and seatbelts ensuring peace of mind on every drive. while the am/fm kenwood stereo with 2 JL audio 10" sub woofers provides entertainment options for those long drives. This 1969 Chevrolet Camaro RS is a remarkable blend of classic design and modern functionality, making it a standout choice for enthusiasts and collectors alike. Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this stunning 1957 Chevrolet Pro Street! Few cars command attention like a Pro Street '57 Chevy, and this example stands among the finest. From its mirror-finish turquoise and white paint to the seamlessly detailed, color-matched chassis, every inch of this build speaks to professional craftsmanship and scrupulous execution. This is the kind of machine that stops shows and dominates streets - equal parts polished beauty and pure brute force. Powertrain Beneath the hood lies a 468 cubic-inch Chevrolet big block V8 that's been twin-turbocharged for jaw-dropping performance. Feeding this powerhouse is a Pro Xtreme Series Velocity intake and a Holley Dominator carburetor tuned by CSU, creating a seamless balance of efficiency and explosive power. Supporting systems include dual turbochargers with heat-wrapped plumbing, an AEM and Aeromotive fuel management system, Allstar Performance breather setup, and JGS Precision wastegates ensuring smooth and reliable boost control. A large aluminum front-mounted intercooler, polished aluminum piping, and braided AN lines complete this competition-grade setup - a visual and mechanical masterpiece. Transmission & Chassis All that power is routed through a Turbo 400 automatic transmission with a B&M ratchet shifter, sending torque to a Ford 9-inch rear end supported by a four-link coil-over suspension. The chassis has been fully boxed, reinforced, and color-matched for exceptional rigidity and presentation. The result is a driveline combination beloved by Pro Street enthusiasts - durable, responsive, and capable of handling immense horsepower with confidence. Interior Inside, the turquoise-and-gray custom interior blends race-ready design with refined craftsmanship. High-back bucket seats and a full roll cage set the tone, while AutoMeter and AEM gauges keep vital stats within easy view. The B&M shifter with line-lock anchors the cockpit, surrounded by upholstery and detail work - even the rear section is finished to the same high standard. Exterior & Undercarriage The exterior showcases a show-quality turquoise and white two-tone finish, polished to a mirror-like sheen. Underneath, the detailed and painted undercarriage mirrors the body's exemplary, featuring smooth frame rails, a polished exhaust system, and that striking aluminum intercooler peeking from the front. Polished wheels wrapped in wide drag radials complete the unmistakable Pro Street stance - aggressive, clean, and absolutely head-turning. Summary This 1957 Chevrolet Pro Street represents the top-tier both worlds - uncompromising performance and masterful presentation. Its twin-turbo 468 Big Block, Turbo 400 transmission, and race-prepped chassis make it a true powerhouse, while its outstanding finish and craftsmanship make it a showstopper. Whether on display, at the strip, or simply out for a cruise, this '57 delivers pure excitement in every sense. This 1957 Chevrolet Pro Street is listed by our Louisville showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and HD video at www.gatewayclassiccars.com . For additional information, please call our knowledgeable staff or email us at Louisville@ gatewayclassiccars.com - Our Louisville Showroom is located at 13576 Blue Lick Rd. Ste A, Memphis, IN 47143. Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to digitally present this time-capsule 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am, an exceptionally original example that embodies the end of an unforgettable era in American performance. This Trans Am stands as a true collector's piece, preserved in remarkable condition and priced accordingly. Finished in Atlantis Blue with the matching blue "Screaming Chicken" hood decal, the car captures everything that made late-'70s Pontiac styling so iconic - muscular lines, shaker hood, and unmistakable road presence. Under the hood rests the factory 6.6-liter V8, paired to an automatic transmission, delivering the torque-rich, smooth performance that made the Trans Am a staple of American roads and silver screens alike. The original interior remains a time capsule of late-'70s design - blue vinyl upholstery, machine-turned dash trim, and the signature three-spoke Formula steering wheel all remain untouched and well-preserved. With no aftermarket modifications, this Trans Am offers a genuine glimpse into 1979 factory originality, right down to the period-correct details that collectors value most. From the iconic snowflake wheels to the detailed bird graphics and hood lettering, it's a rolling reminder of Pontiac's flair for performance and personality - even in an era of change. This 1979 Pontiac Trans Am represents more than just a car; it's an artifact of American automotive identity - a preserved piece of history from when horsepower met attitude and style met substance. This 1979 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am can be seen in detail - including 100+ HD pictures and video - at GatewayClassicCars.com. This vehicle can be seen at the St. Louis Showroom located at 1237 Central Park Drive, O'Fallon IL 62269. Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to digitally present this 1964 Jaguar E-Type (XKE) Series 1. Few cars in automotive history command the respect and admiration of the Jaguar E-Type, and this particular example stands out for its remarkable originality and provenance. Finished in a timeless blue exterior, this E-Type represents the purest expression of Jaguar's 1960s design and engineering brilliance. This is a two-owner vehicle, cherished and preserved through the decades rather than over-restored or heavily modified. The paint remains original, showing light patina and age-appropriate relic that speak to its authenticity and history. Rather than hiding its past, this car proudly wears it-serving as a rolling testament to six decades of careful stewardship. Under the long, sculpted bonnet lies the legendary 3.8-liter inline six-cylinder engine, paired with a 4-speed manual transmission. The car remains largely original mechanically, with only a carburetor modification made for improved drivability. The result is an authentic driving experience that retains the charm and character that made the Series 1 E-Type an icon of its era. Inside, the classic leather interior and wood-rim steering wheel showcase the craftsmanship that defined Jaguar's approach to luxury performance. The view down the long, elegant bonnet remains one of the most recognizable and romantic in motoring history. Highlights include: -Two-owner vehicle with documented provenance -Original paint in blue, showing honest patina and age -3.8L inline six-cylinder engine -4-speed manual transmission -Sole modification: updated carburetor for drivability -Original interior and trim Cars like this 1964 Jaguar E-Type are becoming increasingly difficult to find in such authentic, unrestored condition. It's a time capsule of British design excellence - a car that embodies grace, power, and the enduring soul of motoring history. This 1964 Jaguar E-Type Series 1 can be seen at the St. Louis showroom located at 1237 Central Park Drive, O'Fallon IL 62269. First Name Please provide a first name. Gateway Classic Cars of Dallas presents your opportunity to step into a timeless blend of classic design and modern performance with this stunning 1969 Ford Mustang Fastback Coyote Restomod. Specs: "Powered by Fords 5.0L/435 HP DOHC Coyote V-8, incorporating an Aeromotive fuel system, Doug's ceramic-coated and polished headers with custom side exhaust and a functioning Shaker hood scoop to pump up the performance vibe. Feel yourself shifting through the gears with a Tremec 6-speed manual transmission and 4-link located Moser 3.50:1 Positraction differential with 31-spline axles completing this heavy-duty drivetrain. -TCI front and rear suspension with Ridetech adjustable coilovers, rack-and-pinion steering and Wilwood 4-wheel disc brakes with drilled-and-slotted rotors and powder-coated calipers team up for road-hugging handling delivered by low-profile rubber on chrome American Racing Shelby wheels. -Crimson Red paint with silver striping adorns the exterior, which features custom spoilers and side skirts, hood-mounted turn-signal indicators and a backup camera. The color motif is repeated in the custom interior that features bucket seats and a custom center console, Dakota Digital gauges, a Flaming River tilt column, power windows, Vintage Air and LED lighting throughout. Up-to-date electronics include a custom stereo with Bluetooth, a navigation/camera screen and a Rockford Fosgate amplifier and subwoofers." The 1969 Ford Mustang Fastback holds a revered place in automotive history, celebrated for its muscular stance and commanding presence on the road. Originally part of the first generation of Mustangs that captured the imagination of driving enthusiasts worldwide, the 1969 model year introduced notable design changes that gave it a more aggressive and refined look. This generation of Mustang became a symbol of freedom and performance, capturing the spirit of the late 1960s with its powerful engines and sporty design elements. Today, the 1969 Mustang Fastback remains a sought-after classic, cherished by collectors and car aficionados alike. This Restomod Mustang features an array of modern conveniences designed to enhance your driving experience. Enjoy the comfort of air conditioning and the classic entertainment of an AM/FM radio. Safety and security are prioritized with an anti-theft system, while performance tires and power brakes ensure that every drive is both thrilling and controlled. The inclusion of power locks and power steering adds to the ease of handling, making this a vehicle that is as practical as it is exhilarating. Meanwhile, seatbelts and the luxurious leather interior provide a touch of modern comfort and safety to this timeless classic. A Mustang Fastback built to this level is more than just a car; it's a bridge between the past and the present, offering a unique driving experience that honors its rich heritage while embracing the advancements of modern technology. Whether you're a classic car enthusiast or someone looking for a performance vehicle that stands out from the rest, this Mustang promises to deliver a driving experience that's both nostalgic and forward-thinking. Embrace the legacy of the Mustang with this exceptional Restomod that combines features from both worlds. Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to digitally present this 1970 Dodge Charger R/T Tribute, a high-impact restomod that captures the unmistakable attitude of the golden muscle era with modernized performance and craftsmanship to match. According to its VIN (XH29N0C195121), this Charger began life as a 1970 Dodge Charger two-door hardtop built at Chrysler's Jefferson Avenue Assembly Plant in Detroit. The "N" code originally designated a 383 cubic-inch V8, but this build has evolved far beyond its factory roots - now wearing the R/T look and the performance to back it up. Under the hood sits a 400 cubic-inch big block V8, built with a solid cam (.670 lift) and Mopar Stage 6 heads, creating the kind of raw mechanical symphony that only a big-block Mopar can deliver. Power is routed through a 727 Torqueflite automatic transmission with a 10-inch converter, transferring torque to a 3.91 rear gear setup that makes this Charger leap off the line with authority. Shifts come through a Hurst Quarter Stick, mounted proudly on the tunnel like a badge of honor - every pull of that lever is a reminder that this Charger wasn't built to cruise quietly. It was built to command the road. The build also features Wilwood 4-wheel disc brakes, ensuring that all that muscle has the stopping power it deserves. Finished in Viper Red with R/T badging, hood pins, and a menacing cowl hood scoop, this Charger combines old-school menace with show-stopping presentation. It rides on polished aluminum wheels wrapped in performance rubber, complementing its aggressive stance. Inside, a custom interior pairs black vinyl with subtle modern upgrades, keeping the car true to its vintage vibe while enhancing comfort and control. This restomod isn't about chasing originality - it's about celebrating performance, sound, and presence. Every choice made here serves one purpose: to deliver the kind of driving experience that makes your pulse race and the world around you blur. The 1970 Dodge Charger R/T Tribute is an icon reborn - part showpiece, part street machine, and entirely unforgettable. This vehicle can be seen in detail - including 100+ HD pictures and video - at GatewayClassicCars.com. It can be viewed in person at the St. Louis Showroom located at 1237 Central Park Drive, O'Fallon IL 62269. Gateway Classic Cars Tampa Showroom is proud to digitally present this rare 1970 Plymouth 'Cuda. You hear about the these, you seen them on tv, but you rarely see one come up for sale. Some would say the 1970 Plymouth 'Cuda is the high water mark for 70s muscle. This specific 'Cuda has been in its current owners care for over two decades and was recently resprayed in its original Sand Pebble Beige (BL1) with black stripes (V6X). In 1970, a little less than 19, 000 hardtop 'Cuda's were made compared to over 120, 000 Camaro's. However, only 566 units were adorned in gorgeous Sand Pebble making this a rare color combo. The owner has a file folder to go with the car including the all important Broadcast sheet. This is a "H" code, E55, 340/275hp engine (2780930-340-5) sitting under the hood and connected to the legendary 727 torqueflite trans (D32). The owner has updated to front disc brakes and added an Edelbrock carb. Full disclosure - she needs a little tuning and few things do not work i.e. the radio, horn, and blower motor. However, nothing looks like or draws attention like a '70 Cuda and this unicorn is sitting in all its glory on our showroom floor. Mopar enthusiasts line up! First Name Please provide a first name. Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this stunning 1976 Pontiac Trans Am Resto Mod! Few American icons capture the spirit of late-1970s performance like the Pontiac Trans Am, and this example elevates that legacy to a new level. The result of a painstaking, frame-off, nut-and-bolt restoration spanning more than 2.5 years and completed in May 2023 with complete documentation, this Trans Am combines timeless muscle car attitude with modern performance, reliability, and craftsmanship. Every system-mechanical, electrical, and cosmetic-has been reengineered and rebuilt to a standard far beyond factory specifications. Performance & Drivetrain Under the hood rests a Blueprint Engines 505 HP dyno-tested crate motor, delivering the kind of authentic power muscle car enthusiasts crave. The dyno sheet confirms the numbers, leaving no guesswork. Fuel delivery comes from a Holley 850 CFM double pumper carburetor with electric choke, while a Champion aluminum radiator and dual electric fans keep temperatures steady. Power is transmitted through a professionally rebuilt 700R4 overdrive transmission, known for smooth shifting and effortless cruising. A Ford 9-inch rear end with 3.73 posi-traction gears and new Strange axles ensures durability and precision under acceleration. This drivetrain Merges exhilarating acceleration with relaxed cruising capability, off-the-line performance with relaxed, comfortable highway manners. Chassis, Suspension & Brakes Heidts 4-Link Rear Suspension for precise handling and control, Four-way adjustable coil-over shocks to fine-tune ride quality and stance, Wilwood and CPP braking system with drilled and slotted rotors on all four corners, Stainless steel brake lines for consistent performance. These upgrades deliver a Trans Am that drives tighter, stops quicker, and feels decades ahead of its original design. Interior & Electrical Inside, the quality continues with a complete Legendary Interiors package featuring all-new upholstery, a redesigned console, and modern 160 MPH Firebird instrumentation. A custom steering wheel and B&M shifter give the cabin a performance-oriented, driver-focused feel. Behind the scenes, a new wiring harness ensures reliability throughout the vehicle. LED lighting provides bright, efficient illumination, and all wiring and electrical components have been finished to show-quality standards. Cooling & Comfort Vintage Air modern climate control system, Champion radiator with dual fans for dependable cooling in all conditions. This Trans Am was built for driving enjoyment, whether it's a weekend cruise or a long highway stretch. Exterior & Undercarriage The exterior commands attention from every angle. The show-quality paint finish is complemented by new front and rear glass, fresh chrome moldings, and crisp body lines. It rides on 17-inch Honeycomb wheels wrapped in Toyo Proxes 275/40ZR17 tires, providing a bold stance and top-tier traction. Even the underside of the car was given the same attention to detail as the body. The undercarriage is finished and detailed to show standards, with organized wiring, clean plumbing, and precisely executed suspension work. Summary This 1976 Pontiac Trans Am Resto Mod represents a complete reimagining of an American classic. From its 505 HP engine to its advanced suspension, modern comforts, and outstanding presentation, every inch of this build reflects craftsmanship and dedication. Recreating a car of this caliber today would cost nearly double. For the enthusiast seeking a Trans Am that combines power, comfort, and collectability, this example stands in a class of its own. This 1976 Pontiac Trans Am Resto Mod is listed by our Louisville showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and HD video at www.gatewayclassiccars.com . For additional information, please call our knowledgeable staff or email us at Louisville@ gatewayclassiccars.com - Our Louisville Showroom is located at 13576 Blue Lick Rd. Ste A. Memphis, IN 47143. Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this 1948 Ford Anglia Street Rod! The Ford Anglia began life as a simple British economy car. This one, however, has crossed the Atlantic and gone completely rogue. Beneath its compact shell lives a masterpiece of American engineering - a Boss 514 Ford Hemi by Jon Kaase - the kind of engine that makes grown gearheads stop mid-sentence. Powertrain Deep Dive - Boss 514 Jon Kaase Ford Hemi At the heart of this Anglia sits a 514 cubic-inch Jon Kaase-built Ford Hemi, a legendary big-block known for its brute torque and precision craftsmanship. Kaase, a championship-winning Pro Stock engine designer, built these hemis for those who demand more than power - they demand excellence. With aluminum Jon Kaase Hemi heads, hemispherical combustion chambers, and a 460-based stroker bottom end, this engine breathes effortlessly and revs with frightening smoothness. Estimated output: 650+ horsepower and 650 lb-ft of torque, depending on tune. Cooling is handled by a custom aluminum system, engineered to keep big-block temperatures in check within the compact Anglia body. The 15-gallon fuel cell feeds this beast, and the idle alone tells you it's something special - deep, steady, and pure Kaase thunder. Transmission & Driveline Power is delivered through a TCI C6 3-speed automatic transmission with a TCI performance shifter, built to handle every ounce of torque. Out back, a Strange Engineering rear end and Detroit Locker posi unit ensure both tires stay hooked when the throttle drops. A 3.25 rear gear provides a precision blend of acceleration and highway composure. Chassis & Suspension Underneath, this Anglia rides on an Art Morrison chassis, renowned for precision geometry and strength. A 4-point roll bar adds rigidity and safety, while spindle-mount front wheels and Wilwood disc brakes bring serious stopping power to match the performance. The 15-gallon fuel cell is mounted low for ideal weight balance and handling. Design & Presentation Finished in a brilliant Blue, this Anglia has presence in every sense of the word - squat stance, fat rear tires, and an aura that radiates controlled aggression. Inside, the Black vinyl interior is clean and functional, built for the driver, not for show trophies. Every switch and gauge serves a purpose. Why This Build Matters This isn't a backyard hot rod - it's a carefully engineered machine, crafted from, Jon Kaase, Art Morrison, TCI, Strange Engineering, and Wilwood. The result is power refined by precision, a street rod that blends old-school attitude with race-level hardware. With only 571 miles since completion, it remains as fresh as it is ferocious. If you're searching for a car that's more than fast - one that embodies excellence in every nut and bolt - this Jon Kaase-powered 1948 Ford Anglia is it. Brutal, beautiful, and built right from the first weld. This 1948 Ford Anglia is offered by our Louisville Showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com . For additional information, please call our knowledgeable staff or email us at Louisville@ GatewayClassicCars.com . Our Louisville Showroom is located at 13576 Blue Lick Rd. Ste A, Memphis, IN 47143. Gateway Classic Cars of Philadelphia is proud to digitally present this stunning 1935 Pierce-Arrow Model 845, an elegant and luxurious example of American coach built motoring from the pre-war era. Finished in rich maroon with a complementary tan interior, this Pierce-Arrow presents beautifully and offers the kind of presence only a true classic luxury car can deliver. Pierce-Arrow built its reputation on craftsmanship, smooth engineering and restrained, dignified style - and the Model 845 is a applicable expression of that tradition. Power comes from the long, torque-rich inline eight engine unit, providing effortless and refined forward motion consistent with luxury touring of the era. The drivetrain is period correct: a 3-speed manual transmission that pairs with the Inline-eight for smooth, authoritative progress on the open road. Chassis engineering and mechanical components are also original in character, with conventional I-beam front axle and robust rear driveline components, built for comfort and stability in grand touring service. The Model 845 was designed to be a comfortable, dignified automobile for long-distance motoring and formal appointments. Its plush tan interior, ample seating and well-executed coachwork make it as suitable for classic car shows and parades as it is for private collections and museum display. This particular example shows beautifully in maroon paint and tan upholstery, and its overall presentation suggests careful ownership and preservation. For enthusiasts seeking a true statement piece from the golden age of American luxury automobiles, this 1935 Pierce-Arrow 845 is a rare and elegant find - a car that blends historic significance, mechanical authenticity, and museum-grade presence. Comparable Model 845 examples and auction histories confirm the model's desirability among collectors. Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this 1971 Chevrolet Chevelle 454 SS Tribute! The 1971 Chevelle remains one of the most iconic shapes in American performance history. Broad shoulders, long hood, and that unmistakable stance-Chevrolet's last great big-block era car still speaks with authority. This example captures that presence. Finished in charcoal-metallic gray with crisp white rally stripes, it wears its SS trim and cowl-induction hood with quiet confidence. The reflections are smooth, the stance correct, and the overall presentation clean and honest. Power comes from a 454 cubic-inch big-block V8 breathing through Hooker Competition headers and exhaling through a deep dual-exhaust system. According to the build specifications, the engine is rated at roughly 365 horsepower, the factory figure for Chevrolet's 1971 LS5. Torque output varied by tune-factory literature listed approximately 465 lb-ft-and this setup feels every bit that strong. Cooling is handled by a high-capacity aluminum radiator, giving the car the reliability and temperature control expected from a true driver's build. The engine bay is tidy and purposeful-no flash, just craftsmanship and care. Inside, the black bucket seats with SS embroidery, center console, and factory-style gauges keep the authentic muscle-car look intact. Power steering and power brakes make it easy to enjoy while preserving the feel that made Chevelles legends. The trim tag (ST 71-13637) confirms this car began life as a V8 Sport Coupe built in Baltimore, later restored and finished as a well-executed SS tribute. Solid, clean, and built to be driven-it's a Chevelle that rewards seat time as much as admiration. With its 454 big block, Hooker headers, and aluminum radiator, this Chevelle delivers the balance of strength, sound, and dependability that made the name Chevelle SS a benchmark of American power. This 1971 Chevrolet Chevelle 454 SS Tribute is offered by our Louisville Showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com . For additional information, please email Louisville@ GatewayClassicCars.com . Our Louisville Showroom is located at 13576 Blue Lick Rd Ste A, Memphis, IN 47143. Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this 1965 Sunbeam Roadster! This striking Sunbeam blends classic British design with American V8 muscle. Power comes from a 347 cubic-inch Ford V8 mated to a 4-speed manual transmission, delivering thrilling performance through true dual exhaust and stock-style manifolds. Lightweight, balanced, and brutally quick, this Sunbeam channels the essence of the legendary Tiger with modern precision. Gateway Classic Cars Tampa Showroom is proud to present this beautiful 1971 Chevrolet Chevelle. What's more hard core, true blue, Americana, than a big block Chevelle? First, lets address the elephant in the room. Is this a real "SS" Chevelle or not. Well, it is a 13637 which allegedly the "SS" cars were. It does have the square steering shaft used only for the big block cars. And, it does have the 12-bolt rear diff. When you present the evidence, could it be a real Super Sport? It could be. However, without the factory build sheet and/or an original window stick there's just no way to tell. Now, you can easily take a peek at the front engine pad and see the matching vin number stamped in full display. The BB 402 is smooth, quiet, and powerful. The turbo 400 trans shifts crisp and sharp. You have to see this Chevelle in the light to do it justice. The (62) Burnt Orange Poly is gorgeous and the black interior (706) with the correct Magnesium Rally wheels create a truly beautiful combination. Is this Chevelle more of an oddity or a rarity? With its colorful combo, factory NM big block, and factory A/C, that's a question for you to answer. Chances are you won't find another one like it anywhere. If you are on the hunt for a solid, well cared for, early 70s Chevelle then look no further. First Name Please provide a first name. Last Name Please provide a last name. 1962 Chevrolet Corvette - Sharp Roman Red C1! Gateway Classic Cars of Dallas is proud to present this 1962 Chevrolet Corvette, a stunning final-year example of the first-generation Corvette. When it comes to classic 'Vettes, the last of a generation often holds a special place, benefiting from years of refinement and engineering improvements. This car was professionally finished in Roman Red, according to included receipts, and it now commands attention with its striking red-on-red color combination. The white manually operated convertible top remains in great condition, providing a beautiful contrast to the vibrant exterior. Inside, the matching red interior maintains a correct, stock appearance that feels both authentic and inviting. The three-spoke steering wheel sits in front of the traditional six-pod gauge cluster, keeping all vital information right in the driver's view. A vintage-style AM/FM radio and an aftermarket armrest with an integrated cup holder add a touch of convenience for modern driving while maintaining the car's period character. Under the signature front-hinged hood rests a period-correct 327 cubic-inch V8, the only year it was offered in the C1. The engine breathes through an Edelbrock four-barrel carburetor and matching intake manifold, exhaling through dual exhaust fitted with factory replacement mufflers to create that unmistakable Corvette soundtrack. Power is sent through a four-speed manual transmission with rebuilt shifter linkage, ensuring smooth and precise shifts. While this Corvette retains much of its original charm, it benefits from several thoughtful upgrades designed to enhance reliability and drivability. The car features front disc brakes paired with an upgraded dual-reservoir master cylinder, a new wiring harness, and a new water pump. Included with the sale are extensive maintenance records and the original owner's manual, a testament to the care this car has received throughout its life. As the final iteration of the first-generation Corvette, this 1962 model embodies the ideal of classic American design and performance. With its vivid Roman Red finish, period-correct 327 V8, and tasteful modern enhancements, this car represents an ideal opportunity for anyone looking to enjoy a well-sorted and beautifully maintained C1. Call today to make this final-year classic yours. Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to digitally present this striking 1968 Ford Mustang Restomod, blending iconic pony-car looks with modernized performance and attitude. Finished in a deep, glossy red exterior, this fastback-inspired coupe delivers classic Mustang style with a serious street-machine presence. Beneath the hood sits a 351 Windsor V8, built with performance in mind-featuring Edelbrock aluminum heads, a Straub custom hydraulic roller cam, Keith Black pistons, and roller rockers for responsive power delivery. Backing the small-block is a rebuilt automatic transmission feeding a Ford 9-inch rear end with 3.73 gears and Posi-traction, ensuring the car hooks up and goes when you lay into it. Supporting that power are modernized underpinnings: upgraded QA1-style front suspension, new control arms, bushings, sway bars, and refreshed braking and steering systems. The result is a confident, composed Mustang that feels as sharp on the road as it looks sitting still. Cooling is handled by a seven-core aluminum radiator with dual electric fans, keeping temperatures stable even in spirited driving. Inside, the car retains its classic layout but benefits from new upholstery, carpet, and trim, giving the cabin a clean, purposeful look. A custom steering wheel, functional gauges, and subtle finishing touches tie together the restoration while maintaining that unmistakable 1960s character. Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this stunning 1957 Ford Thunderbird! When Ford introduced the Thunderbird in 1955, it launched a new concept in American motoring, the personal luxury car. Blending performance, comfort, and timeless style, the Thunderbird quickly became an icon. By 1957, the final year of the first generation, its design had been refined to enduring excellence, sleek, elegant, and unmistakably American. Exterior Finished in classic white, this "Baby Bird" radiates 1950s sophistication. Sculpted lines, a wide front grille, and the signature porthole hardtop define its memorable silhouette. Chrome accents, factory badging, and wide whitewall tires complete the period-correct presentation. Interior Inside, a crisp black and white cabin showcases Ford's attention to design and detail. The dash, gauges, and bright trim retain their original mid-century character, while the seating and panels display craftsmanship and care throughout. Engine & Drivetrain Power comes from Ford's 312 cubic-inch V8 paired with a 3-speed manual transmission featuring factory overdrive. The engine bay is clean and well-presented, highlighted by the optional engine dress-up kit that adds an extra touch of refinement. Driving Experience The Thunderbird delivers confident road manners and smooth performance. The manual gearbox provides a connected, engaging drive, while the V8's classic tone adds to its charm on every cruise. This 1957 Ford Thunderbird is listed by our Louisville showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com . Gateway Classic Cars Houston Showroom is proud to present this 1982 Jeep Scrambler is a striking example of rugged capability blended with custom performance. Finished in a vivid red exterior with a clean black interior, this Scrambler captures attention wherever it goes. Powering this Jeep is a 383 Stroker Blueprint V8 engine that delivers exhilarating performance and an unmistakable sound. The engine has only 500 miles since being installed, offering the next owner a freshly built powertrain ready for adventure. Backing the powerful V8 is a T-18 manual transmission, known for its exceptional strength and durability. Jeep enthusiasts often favor the T-18 for its heavy-duty design and ultra-low first gear, making it ideal for off-road crawling or precise on-road control. This particular transmission has been freshly rebuilt and has only 500 miles since the rebuild, ensuring smooth and confident gear changes. Adding to its aggressive stance and off-road capability, this Scrambler has been equipped with a 4-inch lift that provides extra ground clearance and enhances its commanding presence on any terrain. The Jeep rides on a set of custom aluminum wheels wrapped in performance tires, giving it both a bold look and outstanding traction. Power steering and power brakes make handling responsive and easy, while the manual convertible top adds to the open-air experience that classic Jeep owners love. The black vinyl interior is clean and functional, complete with seatbelts and an AM/FM radio to keep things simple and authentic. With its combination of iconic Jeep styling, modern performance, and recent mechanical updates, this 1982 Jeep Scrambler is more than just a collector's piece-it's a ready-to-drive classic built for both show and adventure. Gateway Classic Cars of Dallas is proud to present this stunning 1968 Chevrolet Chevelle. When you think of muscle cars, you think of big-block Chevelles. When you think of big-block Chevelles, you think of raw power, aggressive exhaust notes, and intimidating styling, and boy, does this fine example live up to these hallmarks! For raw power, this Chevelle has a fresh 454 big block fed by a 4-barrel Holley carb. This hearty engine's 400-plus horsepower is fed through a 4-speed automatic to a Chevy 12-bolt Posi rear end. All it takes is a blip of the throttle to light the tires up! For aggressive exhaust notes, this Chevelle features stainless steel headers flowing into 3-inch exhaust pipes. Rev this bad boy up in the driveway and your neighbors will love you! For intimidating styling, the Chevelle features a "can't miss it" yellow paint job with two black stripes running down the hood and the trunk. Shaved door handles with electric poppers give the side of the car a great look, and 17-inch American Racing black mag wheels convey that this muscle car means business. The interior is finished in a period-correct style with black vinyl bucket seats and a console shifter. The gauges are all digital, so you can operate this beast with precision. Further performance upgrades on the car include UMI performance sway bars, drilled front brake rotors, and an aluminum radiator with dual electric fans. If you're looking for a car that screams pinnacle 60s muscle and won't let you forget it, this is the one. It is fresh and ready to roar for years to come! This is the one you want to own. Options include: Air conditioning (Not Blowing Cold), power brakes, power steering, power locks, power front windows, tilt wheel, keyless entry, seat belts, vinyl interior, and radial tires. This 1968 Chevrolet Chevelle is offered for sale by our Dallas Showroom and can be seen in greater detail, including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com . Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this award-winning 1963 Mercury Meteor. In 1963, Mercury called the Meteor "Spirit, Sparkle, and Brawn." This car is all three. A 2021 AACA National First Prize Winner, it stands among the finest Meteors in the country-original, correct, and quietly magnificent. Power comes from the "Lightning 260" cubic-inch V8, paired with an automatic transmission. It starts easily, idles smooth, and drives like a Mercury should-steady, confident, unhurried. The engine bay gleams with concours-level detailing and factory accuracy, from the air cleaner to the last decal. The body wears Sandshell Beige paint over a two-tone brown and beige interior. Chrome and stainless trim gleam, doors close with a solid click, and the dash still carries the proud "M-E-T-E-O-R" script. This car looks right because everything about it is right. Factory air conditioning, power steering, and power brakes make this Meteor both rare and refined. Mercury's 1963 engineering focus-self-adjusting brakes, long-life chassis fittings, and quality you could feel-still shines here. The previous owner was a devoted Mercury Meteor aficionado-well organized, and the kind of man every collector hopes to buy from. His care is visible in every inch, every sound, every start. If you're searching for a car that captures grace without pretense, this AACA award-winning Meteor will speak to you. It's more than a fine Mercury-it's a fine moment in American design, preserved with love. This 1963 Mercury Meteor is offered by our Louisville Showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com . Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this 1957 MG A Coupe! When the MG A debuted in 1955, it marked a new era for the brand - lower, sleeker, and more aerodynamic than its predecessors. While most MG As were open roadsters, the fixed-roof Coupe offered a more refined take on British motoring, combining sporty performance with elegant styling. Today, these coupes are considerably rarer, and finding one in this level of condition is truly special. Powertrain Beneath the hood sits an upgraded 1600cc inline 4-cylinder engine paired with a 4-speed manual transmission. The engine bay is clean and well-detailed, featuring twin SU carburetors and a polished aluminum radiator for improved cooling. This upgrade enhances both drivability and reliability while maintaining the car's authentic MG character. The result is a lively, responsive sports coupe that's equally enjoyable on winding roads or weekend drives. Exterior Finished in a striking gray metallic, this MG A shines with understated sophistication. Its sculpted fenders, signature chrome grille, and flowing lines embody mid-century British design at its finest. The look is elevated further by chrome wire wheels wrapped in wide whitewall tires, giving this coupe a distinctive and stylish stance rarely seen on MGs. Every curve and reflection highlights the care taken in maintaining this example's presentation. Interior Inside, the black vinyl interior remains true to MG's driver-focused simplicity. The slim three-spoke steering wheel, classic Smiths gauges, and purposeful dash layout evoke a pure, analog driving feel. With its coupe roofline, the cabin feels intimate yet comfortable, offering a slightly more refined atmosphere than its open-top siblings. Highlights & Condition, 1957 MG A Coupe body style, 1600cc 4-cylinder upgrade with twin SU carburetors, 4-speed manual transmission, Beautiful gray exterior with black interior, Wide whitewall tires and chrome wire wheels, Polished aluminum radiator upgrade for improved cooling Summary This 1957 MG A Coupe beautifully blends classic British design with tasteful performance upgrades. Its gray and black color combination, wide whitewalls, and 1600cc powerplant make it both a showpiece and a pleasure to drive. Rare, elegant, and beautifully presented, this coupe stands as a fine example of MG craftsmanship and timeless style. This 1957 MG A Coupe is listed by our Louisville showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and HD video at www.gatewayclassiccars.com . Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this 1974 Volkswagen Baja Bug! The Baja Bug was born from off-road rebellion - a grassroots movement that turned humble Beetles into desert legends. Simple, light, and tough, they became symbols of freedom, from California dunes to Mexican backroads. This 1974 Volkswagen Baja Bug carries that adventurous spirit into the modern day, freshly equipped with thoughtful upgrades that make it as capable as it is charismatic. Exterior & Chassis Built for fun and durability, this Bug features a double-tube off-road front bumper and matching rear bumper with skid plate, a 4-point roll bar, custom rock rails, and front tow hooks - all powder-coated in striking Gulf Oil Orange, along with the five original wheels. A roof rack with metal framing and wood-slat floor adds vintage charm and practical storage. The stance comes courtesy of adjustable coil-over shocks and Toyo Open Country AT III all-terrain tires (front P225/75R15, rear 30x9.50R15LT), ready for any terrain. Interior & Comfort Inside, a pair of EMPI racing high-back tweed seats with RaceQuip 4-point harnesses hold you firmly in place. The cabin has been lined with Design Engineering Boom Mat for heat and sound insulation - applied under the carpet, across the rear firewall, and throughout the cabin for a more refined driving experience. VDO gauges monitor oil temperature and pressure, while LASFIT LED headlights provide modern visibility for night runs. Powertrain & Mechanics Power comes from a 1600cc air-cooled 4-cylinder, paired with a 4-speed manual transmission - the classic VW setup known for reliability and mechanical honesty. The engine benefits from a Pertronix 1847An electronic ignition system and Pertronix coil, replacing the original points for cleaner, more efficient firing. The exhaust system features ceramic-coated J-pipes and muffler (8-piece system) for improved flow and longevity. Utility & Accessories Practicality meets preparedness: a battery trickle-charge connector sits conveniently behind the passenger seat, so charging is simple and accessible. Included is an orange spare-parts bag filled with essentials like belts, ignition components, spark plugs, and a small air compressor. The sale also includes a tow bar for RV or truck towing, and the original VW jack (stored in its black bag). Body & Details Fiberglass Baja fenders front and rear, steel firewall reinforcement, replica 1961-1967 taillights, and rear tow loops complete the rugged aesthetic. The entire presentation feels cohesive - old-school Baja personality, modern usability, and tons of character. This isn't just a showpiece; it's a purpose-built, Plug -and- Play adventure machine. It's been upgraded where it counts, restored with care, and finished with imagination. If you're looking for a ready-to-run Baja Bug that blends vintage Volkswagen soul with modern reliability and off-road fun, this one delivers. This 1974 Volkswagen Baja Bug is offered by our Louisville Showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com . For additional information, please call our knowledgeable staff or email us at Louisville@ GatewayClassicCars.com . Our Louisville Showroom is located at 13576 Blue Lick Rd. Ste A, Memphis, IN 47143. Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to digitally present this 1967 Cadillac DeVille Sedan, a striking example of mid-century American luxury at its finest. Draped in a brilliant blue finish with matching blue interior, this DeVille embodies Cadillac's confident statement of prestige and comfort during the late 1960s. Its long, sweeping body lines, stacked headlights, and signature chrome accents make an unmistakable presence wherever it arrives - from a downtown cruise to a Sunday classic show. Under the hood sits Cadillac's legendary 429 cubic-inch V8, paired to a smooth Turbo Hydra-Matic automatic transmission. Power delivery is effortless, with torque available the moment you touch the throttle - a hallmark of Cadillac engineering from this era. The VIN (B73287486) identifies this DeVille as a 1967 model built at Cadillac's Detroit, Michigan assembly plant, originally equipped with the full complement of comfort features that defined the brand's "Standard of the World" reputation. That includes power steering, power brakes, power seats, air conditioning, and electric windows, all designed to ensure the driver and passengers glide along in serene comfort. Inside, the cabin remains a time capsule of 1960s sophistication - plush seating, chrome detailing, and a dash layout that could only have come from Cadillac's design department. The ride quality is unmistakably Cadillac: smooth, quiet, and composed, with a sense of confidence that modern cars still struggle to replicate. This 1967 Cadillac DeVille Sedan stands as a rolling reminder of when American luxury was defined by presence, comfort, and craftsmanship - not just technology. This vehicle can be viewed in detail, including 100+ HD photos and video, at GatewayClassicCars.com, and in person at the St. Louis Showroom located at 1237 Central Park Drive, O'Fallon IL 62269. 1980 Shay Model A - Factory-Authorized Tribute with Under 12, 000 Miles Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to digitally present this 1980 Shay Model A Roadster, an officially licensed Ford reproduction built to celebrate one of the most beloved cars in American history - the 1929 Model A. In the late 1970s, Shay Motor Car Company of Battle Creek, Michigan was granted permission by Ford Motor Company to recreate the iconic Model A using modern manufacturing methods and reliable Ford drivetrains. The result was a limited run of factory-authorized replicas that blended 1930s style with late-20th century drivability - a unique combination that quickly made them collector favorites. This example, showing under 12, 000 miles, has been exceptionally well preserved and showcases the timeless lines of the original Ford design - sweeping fenders, wire wheels, whitewall tires, dual side-mounted spares, and that unmistakable upright grille. Finished in classic two-tone tan and black, it captures the elegance of pre-war motoring with the practicality of modern components. Powering this vintage-styled roadster is a 2.3-liter Ford inline-four engine, paired with a 4-speed manual transmission, offering smooth, dependable performance. Hydraulic brakes, 12-volt electrics, and a modern chassis provide a safer and more comfortable ride than the originals - making it a pleasure to drive and easy to maintain. The Shay Model A represents a rare opportunity to experience the charm of early motoring without the compromises of a true antique. Whether displayed, driven in parades, or enjoyed on sunny weekend cruises, this roadster embodies an era of optimism, craftsmanship, and classic American spirit. This 1980 Shay Model A can be seen in detail - including 100+ HD pictures and video - at GatewayClassicCars.com. This vehicle can be seen at the St. Louis Showroom located at 1237 Central Park Drive, O'Fallon IL 62269. Highlights: Factory-authorized Ford reproduction built by Shay Motor Car Company Only 12, 000 miles on the odometer 2.3L Ford inline-4 with 4-speed manual transmission Hydraulic brakes and 12-volt electrical system Dual side-mounted spares and wire wheels Combines classic 1920s design with modern reliability Ideal for collectors, parades, and vintage touring events First Name Please provide a first name. 1973 Dodge Dart Sedan Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to digitally present this 1973 Dodge Dart, a charming example of Mopar's compact sedan that blended everyday drivability with the rugged reliability of Chrysler engineering. Finished in Deep Chestnut Brown Metallic with a matching beige interior, this Dart embodies the understated elegance and durability that defined early 1970s American sedans. The crisp body lines, wide chrome grille, and generous glass area capture the era's confident, practical design language. Under the hood lies Chrysler's dependable 225 cubic-inch "Slant Six" inline engine, paired with an automatic transmission, offering smooth, easy power delivery that made these cars such beloved daily drivers for generations. The sound and feel of this straight-six remain an instantly recognizable part of Dodge history. Decoding the VIN (LH41C3R366649) confirms this example as a 1973 model built at the Windsor, Ontario plant, configured as a Dart four-door sedan equipped with the 225 Slant Six engine - a drivetrain combination known for its simplicity, fuel efficiency, and longevity. Inside, you'll find a beautifully preserved cabin with its bench seats, column shifter, and factory gauges intact, a time capsule that transports you straight back to the mid-70s American roadways. This Dart's originality makes it a standout for collectors who value authenticity and the lived-in character of an untouched survivor. The Dodge Dart remains one of the most approachable entry points into vintage Mopar ownership - and this 1973 example exemplifies why. It's easy to maintain, easy to drive, and loaded with nostalgic charm that grows rarer by the year. Highlights: VIN: LH41C3R366649 Factory 225ci Slant Six inline engine Automatic transmission Deep Chestnut Brown Metallic exterior / Beige interior Original interior finishes and trim Four-door sedan body Power steering and brakes Built in Windsor, Ontario, Canada This 1973 Dodge Dart Sedan can be seen in detail - including 100+ HD photos and video - at GatewayClassicCars.com. Under the hood, you'll find a robust 1300CC 4 Cylinder engine paired with a smooth 4-speed manual transmission, delivering an authentic driving experience that has captivated enthusiasts for decades. The Volkswagen Beetle, affectionately known as the "Bug, " has a storied legacy that began in the late 1930s. Originally conceived as an affordable and practical car for the masses, the Beetle quickly transcended its utilitarian roots to become a symbol of counterculture and individuality in the 1960s and beyond. Its iconic shape and exceptional reliability have made it one of the most recognizable and beloved cars in the world, with over 21 million units produced. Inside this 1966 model, you'll find a thoughtfully designed cabin featuring both leather and vinyl accents, providing a blend of luxury and durability. The inclusion of seatbelts reflects a commitment to safety, while the AM/FM radio offers a touch of nostalgic entertainment, allowing you to enjoy your favorite tunes as you cruise down memory lane. Every detail of this vehicle has been crafted to enhance your driving experience, making it a remarkable piece of automotive history. Owning a Volkswagen Beetle is not just about driving a car; it's about embracing a legacy. This vehicle serves as a testament to enduring design and engineering, and its charm is sure to captivate both collectors and classic car enthusiasts alike. Whether you're drawn to its historical significance or its unmistakable style, this Beetle is a remarkable opportunity to own a piece of automotive history that continues to inspire passion and admiration across generations. In summary, this 1986 Mercedes-Benz 560SEC is more than just a car; it is a statement of luxury, performance, and innovative engineering. 1982 Chevrolet Corvette Collector Edition Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to digitally present this 1982 Chevrolet Corvette Collector Edition, a stunning example that marked the final year of the C3 generation - the last of the "shark body" Corvettes. This Collector Edition stands out immediately for its Silver Beige metallic paint with graduated fade graphics and matching accent stripes - a finish unique to this model year that gave the C3 a dignified sendoff after fifteen years of evolution. The glass lift-back rear hatch, turbine-style aluminum wheels, and bronze-tinted T-tops completed the exclusive package that set this edition apart from all prior Corvettes. Under the hood lies the Cross-Fire Injection 350 cubic-inch V8, rated at 200 horsepower and paired to a 4-speed automatic transmission - the most advanced Corvette powertrain of its time. The dual throttle-body setup delivered smooth performance and improved efficiency, ushering in the next era of fuel-injected Corvettes. Decoding the VIN (1G1AY0781C511123) confirms this Corvette as a 1982 model, built in Bowling Green, Kentucky, and equipped with the L83 350ci Cross-Fire Injection engine. Inside, the Silver Beige leather interior mirrors the exterior's elegant tone, featuring bucket seats, power windows, power locks, cruise control, tilt-telescopic steering, and factory air conditioning - all the comfort and luxury you'd expect from a late-era C3. The 1982 Collector Edition wasn't just a trim level; it was a celebration of the Corvette legacy. With its exclusive paint scheme, refined drivability, and limited production run, it remains one of the most sought-after examples of early 1980s American performance. Highlights: VIN: 1G1AY0781C511123 Factory L83 350ci Cross-Fire Injection V8 4-speed automatic transmission Collector Edition exclusive two-tone Silver Beige metallic fade Glass rear hatch and bronze-tinted T-tops Power steering, brakes, windows, and locks Air conditioning and cruise control Collector Edition turbine wheels Built in Bowling Green, Kentucky This 1982 Chevrolet Corvette Collector Edition can be seen in detail - including 100+ HD photos and video - at GatewayClassicCars.com. Introducing the 1952 Jaguar C-Type Sports Racer by Proteus, resplendent in a distinctive Curlew metallic exterior color. This stunning homage to classic race cars is paired with a plush and sophisticated Barley leather interior, creating a striking contrast that further accents the car's classic aesthetics. In 2021, Jay Leno and Donald Osborne invited this car to participate in the Concourse d'Elegance in Newport Rhode Island sponsored by the Audrain Auto Museum. Truly a special honor for this vehicle! Designed with intricacy, and precision, this Proteus C-Type is an automotive masterpiece that marries vintage design with modern engineering. At the heart of this car lies a 4.2L I6 fuel injected engine, mated to a Tremec 5-speed manual transmission, offering an exhilarating, high-performance drive that is uniquely satisfying. The interior of the car exudes luxury and practicality in equal measures. The notable features include a fine-quality leather interior and the essential feature of racing seatbelts, complementing the car's evocative shape and ensuring the driver's safety. The addition of the distinctive wire wheels impeccably mirrors the original classic design and completes the car's old-world appeal. This C-Type is not just another sports car; it is a connection to one of the most distinguished legacies in automotive history. With only 52 original C-Type Jaguars ever produced and their illustrious reputation of triple Le Mans victories, it presents enthusiasts with a rare opportunity to partake in automotive history. Since 1980 Proteus only made 260 of these fine cars. This car was originally built for Nigel Forsyth the CEO of Proteus. He had an untimely passing and never took delivery. His signature adorns the fuel cap via inscription. Chris Randall became CEO of Proteus and took delivery of this last C-Type built by Proteus. Each car they made took 2000 hours of labor to replicate. Unique additions have been made to the standard Proteus C-Type, such as upgraded brakes using carbon ceramic pads, and the iconic Le Mans racing light behind the grille. Furthermore, an upgraded radiator ensures better performance and longer endurance. This 1952 Jaguar C-Type Sports Racer by Proteus is truly one-of-a-kind, embodying the ideal blend of vintage design and modern engineering. Availability is extremely limited, making this a unique opportunity for collectors and enthusiasts alike. Seize the chance to own this remarkable machine, a rarity in today's automotive marketplace. Gateway Classic Cars of Las Vegas is excited to digitally present this classic piece of American automotive history: the 1970 Plymouth AAR Cuda, a true icon of the muscle car era. This particular model stands out with its striking green exterior, a color that not only captures the essence of the era but also turns heads wherever it goes. Complementing the exterior is a matching green interior, creating a seamless and bold aesthetic that is sure to appeal to enthusiasts and collectors alike. Under the hood, this AAR Cuda is powered by a robust 340 Six Pack CID V8 engine, delivering the kind of performance that made the Plymouth brand legendary. Paired with a 3 Speed Slap Stick Torque Flite automatic transmission, this vehicle offers a driving experience that is both powerful and smooth, making it a joy to drive on both city streets and open highways. Inside, the car is equipped with an AM radio, providing a touch of nostalgia and a connection to the golden age of motoring. The vinyl interior not only adds to the car's vintage charm but also offers durability and comfort. Safety features include seatbelts, ensuring peace of mind for both driver and passengers. The exterior is complemented by classic bias ply tires and hub caps, which enhance the car's authentic look and feel. For added convenience and driving ease, this Plymouth AAR Cuda comes with power brakes and power steering, making it a pleasure to handle and control. The 1970 Plymouth AAR 'Cuda was a one-year-only, limited-edition muscle car built for the SCCA Trans-Am racing series. Named for racer Dan Gurney's All American Racers team, the AAR 'Cuda featured a unique 340 cubic-inch V8 "Six-Barrel" engine, race-inspired handling components, and a host of distinctive cosmetic features. Production ran for just six weeks, from mid-March to mid-April 1970, with only 2, 724 units produced in total. 340 Six-Barrel engine: The AAR was powered by a special 340 cubic-inch V8 topped with three two-barrel Holley carburetors on an Edelbrock aluminum intake. The engine was officially rated at 290 horsepower and 350 lb-ft of torque, though many enthusiasts believe its output was closer to 340 horsepower. This 1970 Plymouth AAR Cuda is a remarkable example of classic American muscle, offering a unique combination of style, performance, and nostalgia. Whether you're a collector or simply an admirer of vintage automobiles, this car represents an opportunity to own a piece of automotive history. First Name Please provide a first name. Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this breathtaking 1969 Chevrolet Camaro Z/28! When Chevrolet unveiled the Z/28 package, it wasn't just building another muscle car-it was engineering a street-legal race car for the Trans-Am circuit. The 1969 model year became the most celebrated of them all, with aggressive lines, balanced performance, and a stance that continues to define American muscle to this day. This example is a true show-stopper, a trailer queen restored to concours-quality standards. Finished in a vivid red exterior with a striking black and white cloth interior, it captures late-'60s muscle car charisma. The paintwork, bright trim, and interior craftsmanship are exceptional throughout. Open the doors or lift the hood, and every inch-from the undercarriage to the engine bay-is detailed to highest level and clean enough to eat off of. Power comes from the legendary 302 cubic inch (4.9L) V8, the heart of the Z/28's racing heritage. This engine features a 4-barrel carburetor, Edelbrock intake manifold, Edelbrock finned valve covers, chrome air cleaner, and aluminum radiator, combining classic looks with enhanced performance. A 3-inch X-pipe exhaust system with dual MagnaFlow mufflers delivers a deep, throaty tone that announces this Z/28's presence long before it's seen. The driving experience is pure exhilaration, thanks to the Hurst-shifted M21 4-speed manual transmission paired with a 12-bolt rear axle and 4.11 gears-a setup built for acceleration and driver engagement. Modern Wilwood power disc brakes bring confident, precise stopping power, seamlessly blending show-quality presentation with performance-oriented function. Power steering rounds out the package, making every drive both thrilling and controlled. Inside, the black and white cloth and vinyl interior captures period-correct charm with modern comfort. Features like an AM/FM radio with cassette, seatbelts, and a clean, functional cockpit complete the authentic 1960s experience. Showing only 236 miles since restoration, this Z/28 has been very well maintained as a showpiece, not a daily driver. From its mirror-finish undercarriage to its high-revving 302 and Wilwood stopping power, this 1969 Z/28 represents the pinnacle of first-generation Camaro craftsmanship. It's not just a classic-it's an investment-grade muscle car that defines what "show quality" truly means. This 1969 Chevrolet Camaro Z/28 is offered by our Louisville Showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com . For additional information, please call our knowledgeable staff or email us at Louisville@ GatewayClassicCars.com - Our Louisville Showroom is located at 13576 Blue Lick Rd. Ste A, Memphis, IN 47143. Gateway Classic Cars of San Antonio/Austin is excited to present this 1953 Buick Skylark. Buick called it a sports car, which is definitely a stretch, but there's no denying that the dropping door line was directly inspired by European sports cars and gave the Skylark a sporting look. 1690 were built in 1953, and with a sticker price over $5000, it shouldn't be a surprise. Today, they are among the most highly prized collectables of the '50s, standing tall among names like Biarritz, Seville, and Imperial. This stunning vehicle boasts a striking red exterior that captures the essence of 1950s style and sophistication. Complementing its vibrant exterior is a luxurious red and white leather interior, offering a harmonious blend of comfort and vintage charm. Under the hood, the Skylark is powered by the formidable 322CID Fireball V8 engine, topped by a 4-barrel carburetor and that massive air cleaner, plus distinctive chrome valve covers and Buick Green paint. The Skylark is equipped with a range of features that highlight its status as a premium automobile of its time. The automatic convertible top allows for effortless transitions between open-air cruising and a more enclosed driving experience, providing versatility and enjoyment in any weather. Inside, the leather interior exudes luxury, while the power seats offer customizable comfort for both driver and passengers. The inclusion of power brakes, power steering, and power windows underscores the vehicle's advanced engineering, providing ease of operation and a touch of modern convenience. For those who appreciate the finer details, the Skylark is fitted with wide white walls and wire wheels, adding a touch of classic elegance to its overall appearance. The AM radio offers a nostalgic audio experience, connecting you to the golden era of motoring. This 1953 Buick Skylark is a testament to timeless design and innovation, offering a unique opportunity to own a piece of automotive history that continues to captivate enthusiasts and collectors alike. Gateway Classic Cars Houston Showroom is proud to present this thrilling and beautiful, built from the ground up, 1956 Chevrolet Corvette. Being the first generation of many to come, some still argue there are no better corvettes than the C1, and if this was the C1 they did see it would be hard to argue. This C1 corvette was built to compete with the most elite cars in the world, with it entering the Sema Car show. Sporting a wicked red paint job that has that iconic white bubble that flares out from the fenders, it has been paired with a red leather interior, a classic and appealing color combination for the C1 corvettes. As beautiful as the car, the real treat is what the body sits on, a street shop chassis fitted with a late model independent corvette(C4) suspension is a real upgrade and gives the car the stability that is needed due to its others upgrades. Dana 44 posi rear end along with QA1 coil overs also have been added. When lifting up the hood one with be met with a LS6 that has been equipped with a GM hot cam kit and has been paired with a Tremac 5-speed manual transmission. Some more modern features this car now has that it didn't before include power steering, power brakes, but maybe no more important than cold blowing A/C. Imagine yourself behind the wheel of this timeless beauty, cruising along scenic routes and exploring the diverse landscapes of the country. With the top down and the wind in your hair, every journey becomes an adventure, and every mile a testament to the enduring appeal of this classic American sports car. Whether you're navigating winding mountain roads, gliding along coastal highways, or simply enjoying a leisurely drive through the countryside, this 1956 Chevrolet Corvette promises a driving experience that is as memorable as the destinations you explore. Gateway Classic Cars of Tampa is proud to digitally present this incredible 1969 Dodge Charger. First things first. If Bill Hickman would've had this Charger blasting through San Francisco in the 1968 cult classic, "Bullitt, " Steve McQueen would have been in serious trouble. Some from younger generations however, may see Dom's car riding the back tires in, "The Fast and the Furious." While others picture Bo and Luke Duke flipping the open exhaust switch while racing through Hazzard County. Either way, there's nothing more sinister than an all black Charger in your rear view mirror. This tough guy was built by FAME Hotrods and highly respected Vescios Customs of Minnesota and was a three year custom build. The consignor has hundreds of pictures of the process with close to $200k in receipts. A 500hp 6.4l 392 Hemi and a 6-spd manual transmission from Cleveland Performance backed by a 8 3/4 Mopar diff crammed with 3:55 gears puts the charge in this Charger. Vintage Air, Dakota Digital, U.S. Mags, QA1, Wilwood, Kenwood...make this is an automotive greatest hits list! Thousands of man hours went into this build and finding a '68-'70 is no easy task to begin with. Please note, the windshield wipers are inop, and the car is currently set up for rear seat delete, but make no mistake, this is one bad ride. Grap your shades and black leather jacket and let's go. This 1969 Dodge Charger is listed by our Tampa Showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com .
