Gateway Classic Cars Houston Showroom is excited to offer this striking Sunfire Yellow 1970 Plymouth Road Runner for sale. For you Mopar lovers, this bad boy comes with lots of receipts from what appear to be the person who had it restored (most dated in the 2011 timeframe), along with the original Broadcast Sheet (which is safely housed in a glass-faced picture frame). This classic muscle car radiates a bold presence on the road, capturing the essence of a bygone era marked by power and style. Under the lightweight lift off hood (where its original 383 CID V8 was) now is a very muscular 440 CID V8, which is augmented by a polished aluminum high rise "+6" intake featuring the expected triple deuce carb setup. The big 440 is equipped with MSD ignition (including billet distributor, Blaster coil, and digital spark optimizer), and real braided steel lines (with proper AN fittings) handle coolant and fuel flow. Custom stainless headers provide extra scavenging for the exhaust gases into its true dual exhaust system. A giant aluminum radiator helps keep the big block running in the green zone, and with its Brewer's Performance-built A833 4-Speed manual transmission, you'll experience an authentic and thrilling driving experience. Step inside to the sleek black interior, where vintage charm meets modern comfort. An auxiliary 3-gauge cluster under the dash provides monitoring for coolant temp, oil pressure, and volts. The original "Tic Toc Tach" is augmented by the shift-light-equipped Sunpro tach on the steering column. The synthetic leather seating not only adds a touch of sophistication but also ensures a comfortable ride. The vehicle is equipped with an AM/FM radio, providing entertainment options to enhance your journeys. Safety remains a priority with the inclusion of seatbelts, ensuring that the classic appeal does not compromise on essential features. Adding to its robust performance are the BF Goodrich Radial T/A tires, which are known for their durability and grip, making this Road Runner ready to tackle any road with confidence. This combination of classic aesthetics, powerful performance, and essential amenities makes the 1970 Plymouth Road Runner a timeless treasure for any automotive enthusiast, so call or email our Houston Showroom today! Gateway Classic Cars of Nashville is proud to digitally introduce this stunning 1963 Ford Thunderbird Convertible Sports Roadster, a true icon of American luxury and performance. This vehicle boasts a striking Rangoon red exterior and plush red leather interior, creating a bold and timeless aesthetic. Under the hood lies a powerful 390 CID V8 engine, rebuilt with Ertel pistons, Sealed Power moly piston rings, and Clevite 77 bearings. The engine has been bored .040 over, and the rotating assembly balanced within a tenth of a gram, ensuring smooth and reliable performance. A 3-core radiator provides extra cooling, making this Thunderbird as dependable as it is beautiful. The driving experience is further elevated by a 3-Speed Cruise-O-Matic automatic transmission, rebuilt with a B&M shift kit for crisper shifts. This Thunderbird is equipped with a host of luxurious features, including air conditioning, an AM/FM radio, an automatic convertible top, and power amenities such as brakes, seats, steering, and windows. The tilt-away steering wheel and seatbelts add to the comfort and safety of this classic ride. The car sits on the famous Kelsey-Hayes wire wheels with white wall tires, enhancing its vintage charm. This particular Thunderbird is a rare gem, being one of only 455 Sports Roadsters built in 1963. Even more exclusive, it is 1 of just 29 optioned with factory air conditioning, Rangoon Red with matching red interior. Adding to its allure, it is believed to have once belonged to country music artist Alan Jackson, making it a piece of celebrity history as well. Restored in 1989, this Thunderbird has accumulated less than 10, 000 miles since, preserving its condition and ensuring it remains a standout in any collection. Accompanying this classic are numerous original documents, including the dealer invoice and build sheet, offering a glimpse into its storied past. This 1963 Ford Thunderbird Convertible Sports Roadster is not just a car; it's a testament to an era of automotive excellence and a rare opportunity for any collector or enthusiast. Gateway Classic Cars of Chicago is excited to present a step back in time with a touch of contemporary flair in this stunning 1950 Ford Deluxe / Super Deluxe commonly referred to as a Shoebox Ford. The 1950 Ford combines classic design with modern upgrades to create a one-of-a-kind driving experience. Beneath the hood, you'll find an Olds Rocket 350 V8 engine mated to an automatic transmission, operated by a genie tiptronic style shifter ensuring smooth and reliable performance for your journeys. Nearly 200 louvers were added to maximize airflow to the engine and cockpit. The frame on this 1950 Ford Deluxe / Super Deluxe is a full box and X member mated to a Pontiac Firebird sub frame with the original Ford rear end. To give a little history; This 1950 Ford Deluxe / Super Deluxe was customized in Huntington Beach California where it was purchased by the current owner in 1985. The top is a true California "Carson" lift off top which features a custom headliner displaying the iconic Wurlitzer 1015 "Bubbler Jukebox" that lights up. The interior color scheme is just as impressive as the exterior and contains two-tone 60/40 split power seats. The doors were rehung to open suicide style and are power operated. The trunk was chopped and customized to a rumble seat compartment which is also power operated. The grab bar for the rumble seat was made from Marine grade stainless steel and has it's own lighting and speakers. The windshield was chopped 3 1/2 inches, custom step plates were sculpted into the left quarter panels while each step is lighted and adorned in with a Chrome Oldsmobile emblem to signify the powerhouse below the hood. It has been lowered by 2 inches and rides on custom wheels wrapped in radial tires, complete with white walls that add a touch of retro class. Notable features include front power disc brakes, power seats, power windows, and power locks, all designed to enhance your driving convenience. The tilt steering wheel offers a more personalized driving experience, while power steering and power brakes ensure that handling this classic beauty is as effortless as it is enjoyable. Among the many added custom features are frenched blue dot headlights, frenched Jaguar P-80 headlights, Dodge Viper Road lights are molded into the custom grill, period correct Marilyn Monroe steering knob and the original drivers side mirror with thermostat. The am/fm radio with CD player allows you to enjoy your favorite tunes on the go and the original Mopar Hi-Way HIFI 45 rpm under the dash is a nice blast from the past. Gateway Classic Cars of Nashville is proud to present this 1968 Chevrolet Chevelle SS 396. Only this Chevelle has 100 more cubic inches under the hood. This SS496 Chevelle looks sharp in what some call arrest me Red, with black interior, bucket seats and center console complete with Horseshoe shifter. Under the hood, this Chevelle houses a robust Blueprint 496 cubic inch V8 engine with aluminum heads that delivers 600 horsepower and 615-foot pounds of tire destroying torque. Paired with a TH400 3-speed automatic transmission, it offers crisp shifts and the legendary longevity that Turbo 400's are known for. The power exiting the transmission is routed to a 12-Bolt rear axle that houses 4.11 gears and Positraction. Because two black lines are better than one. Stay cool and comfortable on the road with the aftermarket Vintage Air HVAC system. The Cragar S/S rims and BFG T/A's add a touch of nostalgia to the overall look of this classic. This 1968 Chevrolet Chevelle SS 396 should be the poster car for the late 60's as it was produced in the middle of the muscle car war of that time. What a wonderful time to be alive. The music was great, you could drink from a garden hose without concern and cars like this were everywhere. Here is your chance to own a piece of your past, that car you always wanted. Gateway Classic Cars of Tampa is proud to digitally present this extreme 1969 Chevrolet Camaro. The first generation Camaro just may be the most highly sought after pony car of all time and with one look it's easy to understand why. This particular '69 Camaro has been in the same family for years and was built for one reason and one reason only, going fast. This is a real deal, all metal (except the hood), street/strip, Saturday night shootout...whatever you want to call it. It's a full interior car you can drive to the track, blast a ten second quarter mile pass, and drive home after hitting the drive through. The 555 Brodix big block puts out a dyno proven 600+ to the rear tires on pump gas. The nasty mill flashes faster than a small block and sounds like it's mad at the entire world. Underneath, everything is full adjustable front to rear from Strange adjustable shocks to the Caltrack control arms. Smash the gas and the Tremec T56 sends the massive big blocks torque to the bullet proof 9" rear diff. Wildwood brakes bring everything to a safe stop. If you don't want to get kicked out of your HOA then don't buy this Camaro...then again...it might not be the worst idea. Is she a Trailer Queen show car? No. Is she a twin turbo meth head you can tune on the fly? No. This is a throw your jacket to the ground, bare knuckle brawler looking for a fight. Maybe we should name it, Balboa? Gateway Classic Cars of Scottsdale is excited to digitally present this 1956 Chevrolet 210, a stunning blend of classic design and modern performance. This iconic vehicle boasts a striking red exterior that complements its equally vibrant red interior, creating a cohesive and eye-catching aesthetic. Under the hood, this classic Chevy has been transformed with a powerful LS3 V8 6.0L engine, offering a thrilling driving experience. The engine has been tastefully upgraded with LS3 aluminum heads and a 6.0L bored out +.30, ensuring enhanced performance and reliability. The Edelbrock single runner manifold and MSD ignition box setup work in harmony with the FiTech EFI complete system master kit to deliver precise fuel management and ignition control. The LS ProTrack pulley kit, cam & lifter kit, LS7 Delphi lifters, and LS lifter tray with bolt set further enhance the engine's capabilities. A Camshaft LS hydraulic roller stage 2, ceramic wiring plugs, and new crank and cam sensors complete the impressive list of engine upgrades, ensuring this Chevrolet 210 is ready to deliver an exhilarating ride. Additional enhancements to this vehicle include a 10-bolt posi-trac rear end with 3.73 gears, providing improved traction and stability. The full roll cage with removable side bars adds an extra layer of safety, while the dual H pattern 3-inch exhaust system with 2 1/2 inch chrome turn downs offers a deep, resonant exhaust note. For those who enjoy a bit of track action, the Line-Lock activation button on the shifter is a welcome feature. The upgrades listed are just a handful of the many mechanical and functional upgrades added to this beautiful ride. This 1956 Chevrolet 210 sits on stylish 15 inch American Racing aluminum wheels wrapped street legal drag slicks, 235/60 in the front and 275/60 in the rear. Inside, the vehicle features seatbelts and a durable vinyl interior, ensuring comfort and safety for both driver and passengers. This classic Chevy is a testament to the timeless appeal of vintage automobiles, enhanced with modern performance upgrades for an unforgettable driving experience. Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis is proud to digitally present this 1957 Studebaker Golden Hawk. An icon of 1950s performance and style, this Matador Red Golden Hawk has undergone an extensive 2-year body-off frame rotisserie restoration, blending vintage flair with modern engineering. Under its bold, aerodynamic lines sits a performance-built 383ci/450hp Stroker V8, featuring a roller cam, Edelbrock carburetor, MSD ignition, and an array of high-performance internals. Paired with a 4L60E 4-speed automatic transmission and TCI transmission controller, this Golden Hawk delivers both power and refinement. Upgrades are extensive: Ford 9" Posi rear with 3.50 gears, Ridetech 4-link rear suspension, Wilwood 4-wheel power disc brakes, Ridetech coilovers, and rack & pinion power steering ensure precise handling. A Fat Man Fabrications front clip, billet TruTrac serpentine system, and Wizzard aluminum radiator with dual fans keep this classic running cool and confident. Comfort and convenience were not overlooked-Vintage Air conditioning, power windows, 6-way power seats, "I Did It" steering column, and premium sound insulation make every drive a pleasure. The American Racing wheels complete the look, blending modern stance with timeless presence. This 1957 Studebaker Golden Hawk is more than a restoration-it's a reimagining of one of America's most distinctive performance coupes, built to be driven and admired. This 1957 Studebaker Golden Hawk is for sale by Gateway Classic Cars of St. Louis and can be seen at the O'Fallon, IL showroom. Gateway Classic Cars of Tampa presents this amazing 1978 Toyota FJ Cruiser. This iconic overlander is a testament to the rugged, reliable and versatile reputation of the famous Toyota FJ series of 4x4s. This red beauty is a Bolivian import and was blessed with a full mechanical overhaul. It now packs a 4200cc inline six with a bored block and matching pistons, plus all new rotating assembly and associated components. To ensure this 4200 six can get the most of its displacement, a Davis Unified Ignition handles spark and timing duty with a boost in power and reliability. It's far more efficient and simpler - a great upgrade. All that Spark is useless without fuel, but this 4200cc six is fed with a multi-point fuel injection system too. This 78 FJ is now a powerhouse of a 4x4! The engine literally yanks this truck around in manner the original motor never did. A fresh stainless steal exhaust helps the FJ breath and gives a lovely exhaust note. All this power is transmitted though a completely rebuilt transmission with new gears, bearings, shift forks and clutch. Externally the Red FJ has a great presence. It's got a rust-free, bright red body with white roof and grill sitting on a set of 35x11 15inch BF Goodrich tires wrapped around factory 15" wheels. The front winch and off-roading jack and chrome tow hook give the Jeep a rugged and ready vibe this 4x4 can easily back up. Inside it's all business with cloth seats front and rear, rubber floor mats, and a nice dash with the standard grey gauges for functional simplicity. All the gauges work and when you glance around the rear there's a roll bar for added safety in the event of a rollover. In conclusion this FJ is an amazing example of the breed with all the upgrades for functionality and performance with none of the compromises. It's ready to go; drives great and can do hard work, or casual beach cruising. It's nice enough to serve as a collection piece or even show duty. These are great 4x4s and this 1978 FJ will make everyone happy. Make it yours today First Name Please provide a first name. Last Name Please provide a last name. Gateway Classic Cars Houston Showroom is excited to offer this unique 1981 Pontiac Firebird Trans Am for sale. While it may LOOK like an '81 Turbo T/A on the outside, it's come far from its original configuration. According to the (included) original build sheet, this little beast was originally red, in and out. It was part of a custom ProTouring build, done in Florida around 2012. Since its current owner purchased it, he had almost everything done over on it, as the build had aged a bit. About the only thing he didn't have "touched" were the engine and transmission internals. The car came with its unique rear opening hood already set up, but over the years, its alignment had gotten off kilter slightly, so during the teardown and updates installation at Classic Cars of Houston, that was adjusted. Under the hood is a built LS2, which reportedly is sending 511 crank HP through the Tremec T56 6-speed manual to the 10-bolt rear with its 3.73:1 PosiTrac-enhanced gears, netting 419 RWHP. That's plenty of power to light those 245/45ZR17 Mickey Thompson radials up whenever you want! And, if you're unable to control your desire to smoke the tires, one nice thing about the setup is that they are the same size at all four corners, so you can rotate them at least once before having to buy a rear set. Some key updates include a complete Detroit Speed (DSE) hydroformed front clip (which has been powdercoated), new DSE engine mounts, single adjustable shocks, new tubular control arms, new sway bars, all urethane suspension bushings, new DSE solid body mounts, new Wilwood 6-piston front calipers with slotted multipiece front rotors, drilled and slotted rear rotors, and the custom 17-inch snowflake pattern aluminum wheels that look like the originals, but are 2 inches larger diameter. Classic Cars of Houston (CCH) also added an LS Front Runner setup with power steering, DSE hard line kit, new Gen 4 Vintage Air, updated the brake lines to all stainless steel, installed subframe connectors, revised the rear suspension from its former 2-inch drop to a more ride-friendly 1-inch drop, installed stainless shorty headers with V-band connection to the new stainless dual exhaust (which also has stainless mufflers), installed a larger Griffin aluminum radiator with twin electric fans and a proper fitment for the LS engine's steam port. The upgrade to the DSE front clip also necessitated a revision to the driveshaft length and the transmission tunnel, as well as a new transmission crossmember, so as things were resized and reinstalled, extensive use of DynaMat was implemented to reduce cabin noise. In the cabin, due to the transmission tunnel reconfiguration, the center console was reconfigured, and the shifter was enhanced with 1-inch shorter throws. With the many changes, CCH also elected to install a new complete wiring harness tailored for the revisions. Inside, the driver is greeted by the new Dakota Digital dash behind the tilt steering wheel, and front occupants will enjoy the two-tone leather covered power seats. Rear passengers get the same two-tone leather treatment, but they'll not likely enjoy riding out back for long (unless they're car-loving kids that fit in the seats without being scrunched in, of course). In addition to the upgraded interior, audiophiles will enjoy the powered Focal subwoofer, and the amazing sound quality that the Mosconi amp pushes through the Focal 6X9 speakers in the rear and Virtus Nano Morel front component speakers. Of course, a new Alpine head unit starts the flow of aural enjoyment, but audiophiles know it's those Focal speakers that make the sound so clear. Everyone in the cabin will enjoy the new Vintage Air HVAC, which provides year-round comfort. This is one extreme ProTouring build, which provides the look of a vintage F-body with the performance of a modern LS-powered muscle car. Unlike many, this one comes with a nearly 3-inch-thick binder of receipts, the original build sheet, lots of build documentation photos, original owner's manual, you'll have a laundry list of "what's what and how much it cost" to peruse. Its current owner's receipts and build info from CCH total out to over $66, 500 in parts and labor, which breaks down to over $36K for nearly 400 hours of customization labor during the refresh in 2018-1019, and $30K in parts. Don't miss out on this bad boy - call or email our Houston Showroom to make it yours! First Name Please provide a first name. Last Name Please provide a last name. Gateway classic cars of Nashville is excited to digitally present to you this 1970 Ford Torino GT. Have you ever thought it would be great to find a car that is still owned by the original owner and the owner took this cool car and made it even cooler through the years with performance upgrades? Well here you go! This 1970 Ford Torino GT is in my opinion awesome! It looks sharp in it's deep blue paint and decals a lighter blue was used in the interior which looks stock but the notch for the shifter says otherwise. Under the hood is Blue print 347 cubic inch stroker that should be pumping out about 415 Horses. Long tube headers, Holley double pumper four barrel and H.E.I. as well as serpentine belt and aluminum radiator. This is one tight car! The trans of choice here is the Hughes performance AOD which is as new as the muscle in front of it and is controlled by a B&M shifter. To handle this power a Currie ford 9 inch rear axle holds up the rear and plants the muscle to the street and houses a set of 4.3:1 gears. Tubular control arms up front to handle the cornering and 4 wheel disc brakes because this much power requires them. This car is ready to hit the streets just to cruise or to let the boys know that grown men are here to play. Options for this 1970 Torino GT include: Air conditioning, ( needs recharge) CD player Power Rack and pinion steering and brakes, Tilt steering column, Seat belts, Posi traction and Centerline rallys . Cool Fords like this don't come along everyday! First Name Please provide a first name. Last Name Please provide a last name. Email Please provide an email address. Gateway Classic Cars Houston Showroom is excited to present this very custom all steel 1933 Ford Tudor Sedan. This sweet ride is no trailer queen, either - with a tick over 2400 miles on it, it's clearly built to be driven to all of the shows it's going to win! Suffice it to say that space limitations will apply to how much detail we can go into on this car, because it is one of the most intricately thought out (and executed) custom street rods we've had the pleasure of hosting! There are two giant 3-ring binders with over 1000 photos chronicling the project's build, and a large expandable portfolio full of receipts and operating instructions for many of the parts and systems. The beautiful purple paint is by PPG, and although there is a "Spray Out Card" with the final color, it does not identify the color code. But don't let that distract you from the exceptional paint and body work - there's nary a ripple or wave, and the finish is smooth as glass. As your eyes wander all over, in, and under this car, you'll notice that virtually everything is either chromed, ceramic coated, or powder coated and buffed to a high gloss. Some of the contributors involved in the build and subsequent additional customization include Pro Design Hotrods (Santa Ana, CA); Angel's Body Shop (paint and body work, located in Montclair, CA); Bitchin Products (battery box, floor pan, and firewall); Lokar (hand brake, flex dipstick); Mission Plastics (custom designed and manufactured parts, Ontario, CA); Walton Fabrication (Upland, CA); Tempe Speed and Performance (Tempe, AZ); Rootlieb, Inc. (steel reproduction panels); Rocky Hinge (power door locks, bear claw latches); Vintage Air (HVAC); and Zig's Street Rods (power windows). Under the custom front opening hood lurks a small block Chevrolet 5.7L V8, backed by a 4-speed automatic transmission, which is controlled by a Mooneyes Smart Shift pushbutton system. The 5.7L LT1 is a "Serpentine Show Chrome Short TPI" package by Street & Performance from Mena, AR, and there is so much chrome and polished billet aluminum in the engine bay that you could blind yourself. Exhaust is handled by a completely ceramic coated MagnaFlow modular system. This gorgeous '33 is sitting on a custom powder coated chassis featuring an integrated driveshaft safety loop (mfr. unknown but may be by Total Cost Involved). The frame has also been powder coated in a complementary shade of lighter purple. It features a fully adjustable coilover suspension, with polished chrome upper and lower control arms up front, Mustang II-style steering rack, fully adjustable multilink rear, slotted/drilled rotors with polished multi-piston calipers at each corner, and a Ford 9" rear with limited slip differential. It's riding on a set of Halibrand billet aluminum wheels (custom specified and built for this car), which are wrapped with performance radial tires. After you've thoroughly soaked up the attention to detail evident in the exterior, engine bay, and undercarriage, you'll want to hop in and hit the highway to show it off! Open the suicide doors and notice the aroma of fine leather that will waft into your nostrils. The seats are covered in a combination of leather, perforated leather, and Alcantara. The gray carpet is in great condition, and the gray Alcantara headliner adds a luxury touch. Drivers will appreciate the ability to tailor their driving position thanks to the power seat and the Flaming River tilt steering column, and the front passenger will appreciate their power seat. Custom billet aluminum dash panels house Classic Instruments electronic gauges on the left behind the Flaming River banjo-style steering wheel, and the clock on the right. A Classic Instruments "Sky Drive" GPS speedometer sender helps ensure accurate speed control, which is a good thing, because you'll want to turn up the wick every so often, and the attention this car gets on the road might attract more than just admirers. A custom sound system is hidden behind the rear seat and features a Kenwood KDC-352U AM/FM/CD head unit, Pioneer HD Radio tuner, Infinity Reference speaker controllers, a Pioneer subwoofer, and JL Audio 500W amp (2x100W front, 2x25W rear, 1x250W subwoofer). The Optima battery is tucked securely away back there as well and is housed in a Bitchin Products aluminum battery box. As you'll see if you visit the complete ad for the car on our website, we have over 150 photos of this masterpiece, along with the documentation that will come with it. Don't miss out on this one of a kind, "daily driver capable" show car - call or email our Houston Showroom today! First Name Please provide a first name. Last Name Please provide a last name. Its eye-catching Orange metallic exterior is complemented by a sleek black interior, creating an aura of authority and elegance that turns heads wherever it roams. The addition of aluminum and custom wheels, along with racing slicks, further enhances its aggressive stance and road-gripping capabilities. The Camaro line was introduced by Chevrolet in 1966, designed to compete with the Ford Mustang in the emerging pony car segment. The 1970 model year marked the beginning of the second generation of Camaros, with a complete redesign that featured a more elongated and sculpted body style. The Camaro quickly established itself as an icon of the muscle car era, celebrated for its performance, style, and versatility. The SS, or Super Sport, package offered enhanced performance features that appealed to those seeking a thrilling driving experience, solidifying its status as a legend in American automotive history. This particular Camaro comes equipped with modern conveniences such as power brakes, power locks, and power steering, ensuring both safety and comfort. Seatbelts provide an additional layer of security, allowing you to enjoy the drive with peace of mind. Whether participating in a car show or simply taking a weekend drive, this Camaro is built to impress and perform. Owning the 1970 Chevrolet Camaro is not just about possessing a vehicle; it's about becoming part of a rich tradition that celebrates the spirit of American muscle. Experience the legacy, power, and style that only a true classic can offer. Gateway Classic Cars of Tampa is proud to offer this eye catching 1970 Chevrolet Camaro SS. By 1970, the "Pony Car" wars were in full swing and some would argue was the high water mark for iconic American muscle. It was the first year for the new platform of second generation Camaro's and the now legendary "Split Bumper" front end was unlike anything else on the road. The current owner believes this stunning Daytona Yellow (51) Super Sport to be an original survivor that's led a pampered and sheltered life and was treated to a recent high quality respray. Under the hood, you'll find a highly detailed engine bay housing the numbers matching 350ci engine and factory air-conditioning which still blows cold. Take a peek underneath and you'll spot a smooth shifting Turbo 350 trans, 12-bolt rear differential, and an undercarriage that rivals a full rotisserie restoration. Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this powerful 1971 Ford Torino Coupe! The Ford Torino earned its place among America's great muscle cars with bold styling and serious performance. By 1971, it had evolved into a wider, more aggressive machine that captured the golden age of horsepower. This beautifully restored example carries that legacy forward with modern upgrades that enhance both strength and refinement. Driving this 1971 Ford Torino is an absolutely visceral experience, a blend of brute force, control, and modern precision wrapped in classic American muscle. Every upgrade was chosen to elevate how it drives, sounds, and feels behind the wheel. Finished in brilliant Orange over a Black cloth and vinyl interior, this Torino makes a bold statement. The cabin is clean and comfortable with power steering, seatbelts, and an AM/FM radio for classic cruising enjoyment. Power comes from a custom-built 545 cubic inch Ford big block V8, developed from a 460 block and estimated at 715 horsepower. A C6 automatic transmission with a shift kit and transbrake delivers crisp, firm shifts and thrilling acceleration. The Holley Sniper fuel injection system adds modern reliability and throttle response, while a Champion aluminum radiator with dual fans and a transmission cooler keeps everything running cool. Caltrac suspension and Viking shocks improve traction and stability, allowing the car to stay planted under power. A Flowmaster exhaust delivers a deep, commanding tone that matches its muscle car character. Wilwood disc brakes provide modern stopping confidence, and the Cragar wheels wrapped in radial tires complete the classic performance look. A Ford 9-inch rear end with 3.83 gears offers strong acceleration and easy cruising. With about four years of ownership and a history in New York, this Torino reflects pride and care throughout. Behind the wheel, it feels raw yet composed, powerful yet precise. The throttle reacts instantly, the ride is stable, and the braking inspires complete confidence. This Torino does not just look the part; it delivers the full muscle car experience every time you turn the key. This 1971 Ford Torino is listed by our Louisville showroom and can be viewed in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com . For additional information, please call our knowledgeable staff or email us at Louisville@ GatewayClassicCars.com . Our Louisville Showroom is located at 13576 Blue Lick Rd. Ste A, Memphis, IN 47143. Gateway Classic Cars Louisville is proud to digitally present this 1968 Dodge Dart, a true icon of American muscle car history. A masterpiece that combines classic styling with modern performance enhancements. This stunning vehicle boasts a striking yellow multicolor graphic exterior that captures attention and admiration wherever it goes. The black interior provides a sleek and timeless contrast, ensuring that the aesthetic appeal is as powerful as the engine beneath the hood. At the heart of this beast lies a formidable 426 Hemi 572 CI V8 engine, paired with a 727 Torque Flite automatic transmission featuring a Hughes torque converter with a 3000 stall. This combination promises an exhilarating driving experience, delivering power and performance that muscle car enthusiasts crave. The Dana Locker rear end with 5:13 gear ensures that every ounce of power is effectively transferred to the road, making this Dart a force to be reckoned with. The exterior is further enhanced by aluminum wheels and performance tires, which not only add to the visual appeal but also contribute to the vehicle's outstanding handling capabilities. The fiberglass hood and front fenders, along with acid-dipped doors, reduce weight and enhance performance, while the Chromoly roll cage provides added safety and rigidity. Under the hood, Davis step headers and an A&A intake with carburetors work in harmony to optimize engine performance. The Painless wiring harness ensures reliable electrical connections, while the Defender SR transmission cooler maintains optimal transmission temperatures during spirited drives. The Hurst Pro-matic shifter offers precise gear changes, enhancing the overall driving experience. Safety and control are paramount, with front and rear disc brakes providing reliable stopping power. The QA1 front shocks and adjustable rear coil-over suspension allow for fine-tuning of the ride and handling characteristics, ensuring that this Dart can tackle any road with confidence. Inside, seatbelts are included to provide essential safety for occupants. This 1968 Dodge Dart is not just a car; it's a statement of power, style, and engineering excellence. Whether you're a collector, an enthusiast, or someone who appreciates the legacy of American muscle, this Dart is sure to impress with its blend of classic charm and modern performance upgrades. transmission: 727 torque flite with manual valve body Automatic
description: Gateway Classic Cars Milwaukee is excited to present this 1966 Dodge Charger. This first-generation Charger was manufactured from 1966-1967 as Dodges introduction into the muscle car market. This 1966 Dodge Charger is painted in stunning electric blue with a beefy set of five-spoke alloy wheels. The unique black vinyl interior comes with a floor shifter, power windows, and a Sony AM/FM radio mounted in the glovebox. The interior was uniquely designed with four bucket seats and a center console that runs the length of the cockpit. Stressing the muscle car image, the Charger was only sold with four V-8 engine options. Distinguished by its fastback roofline, "electric shaver" front grille, and full width rear taillights this 1966 Dodge Charger is a head turner. Under the hood of this monster is a 383 V-8 stroked out to a 496. Attached to an automatic 727 Torque Flite transmission with a manual valve body, transferring power to the rear wheels through a 3.55/ 3000 stall rear end. Engine build features include Indy EL heads, Stage II MW porting, Comp Cams spring cups, M/M custom hydraulic roller cam, Indy 1XY intake, and Comp Cams Pro Magnum rockers. Power steering and power Wilwood four-wheel-disc brakes round up this unique build. For more information on this 1966 Dodge Charger contact us at (262)891-4253. Gateway Classic Cars Houston Showroom is proud to present this 1968 Chevrolet Corvette. The 1968 Chevrolet Corvette (L36) marks the birth of the third generation, known as the C3, a turning point in the Corvette's lineage. That year, Chevrolet introduced a completely redesigned body, reimagined interior, and new roof options. Coupes gained removable T-top roof panels and a removable rear window, allowing for a semi-open air experience. The front styling adopted a longer, more pointed nose, with vacuum-operated hideaway headlights and flush door handles with push-button releases. Behind the front wheels are functional louvers, and a new ventilation system dubbed "Astro-Ventilation" was added. Before you is a bronze 1968 Corvette that carries those C3 hallmarks boldly. Its exterior Bronze paint catches light so that the sweeping curves-from the coved fenders to the rear hips-stand out in every direction. The roof includes T-tops, which when removed open up the cabin overhead for a fresh air drive. The profile shows the front fender vents and the stretched silhouette, recalling how Chevrolet reshaped the Corvette for that model year. Inside the car, the interior is trimmed in black vinyl. The seats, dashboard, and door panels present that classic contrast of the bold exterior and darker cabin. A working AM/FM radio resides in the dash, offering that period-appropriate sound. On the safety front there are seat belts provided for occupants. Mechanically this Corvette is equipped with a 427 CID V8 engine mated to a Muncie 4-speed manual transmission. Power steering aids control and maneuvering, and power brakes are fitted. The wheels wear hub caps over radial tires that accent the car's footprint, and the overall stance gives a sense of the Corvette's sporting ambitions without overstatement. This is a car that embodies the 1968-C3 Corvette style features: the aggressive lines, the dramatic roof options, the presence of performance-oriented systems like power steering and brakes, and the interior designed for driver engagement. If you appreciate automotive design, collectible value, or simply the joy of driving a Chevrolet classic, this orange 1968 Corvette shows a lot of what makes that generation special. Gateway Classic Cars Tampa Showroom is excited to present this 1967 Chevy II "SS" Tribute. While Corvette, Camaro, and Mustang sales have slowed some, the second generation Chevy II Nova is still highly sought after. This '67 has been garage kept and only taken to Saturday car shows over the last several years. A metal cowl induction hood, torque thrust wheels, bright yellow paint, tinted windows, and gorgeous chrome makes it impossible not to stare at this beauty. There are 327 call outs on the front fenders, but under the hood is a mean spirited 283ci small block. The chop from the cam flowing from the dual exhaust while waiting for the light to turn green, or when shifting the four speed trans, just sounds wicked. Whenever we've had a "Deuce" before, they never lasted long and always create a feeding frenzy. These little Nova's are getting very hard to find, but here's the opportunity to own a good one! This 1969 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray Convertible has undergone a rotisserie frame-off restoration, resulting in a beautifully restored classic. The car features a LeMans Blue exterior finish that is complemented by Rally wheels with Redline tires. It is equipped with a white convertible top as well as a black vinyl hard top, offering two distinct styling options. The car is powered by a 350-horsepower 350 cubic inch V8 engine paired with an automatic transmission. The engine compartment includes an Edelbrock aluminum intake and Edelbrock carburetor. An aftermarket Vintage Air Conditioning system and a retro-styled stereo system have been installed. The interior details, including the seats and instrument cluster, have been restored, and the car is also equipped with Stingray floor mats. The Corvette includes classic side exhaust pipes, and additional features include Coker tires and detailed bodywork. This car reflects the design and engineering of its time and provides an opportunity to own a representation of the 1969 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray Convertible. Gateway Classic Cars of Louisville is proud to present this 1973 Volvo 1800ES Wagon! In the late 50s Volvo was well under works to develop a sports car that would compete in both the US and European markets. The P1800 debuted in 1961 and was more powerful and robust than the former model. Variants would be offered over the years and the 1800ES Wagon was released in 1972 and would only be made for 2 years. Just under 48k units would be made across the variants from 61-73. This model is a '73, the final year and wow is she sharp! The green paint combined with the chrome really stands out and look good. The brown leather seats are comfortable and in good shape and per the owner is the original interior. Under the hood is a 2.1L Inline 4-Cylinder engine that is backed by a 4-Speed Manual Transmission w/Overdrive. The car runs, drives, and shifts out very well. Current owner has had her for over 12 years, acquired from Alan Auto out of Portland Maine. Car comes with a custom fit car cover and was Ziebarted to prevent rust. Looking under the Ziebart still looks good along with the stainless exhaust. Odometer shows 40k miles and is believed original. The title is clean with no brands. These cars don't turn up very often, don't let this one get away and give us a call today! Options on this Volvo include: A/C, Power Brakes, Leather Interior, AM/FM/Cassette Radio, Seat Belts, Rally Wheels, and Radial Tires. This 1973 Volvo 1800ES Wagon is offered by our Louisville Showroom and can be seen in greater detail including 100+ HD pictures and an HD video at www.GatewayClassicCars.com . Gateway Classic Cars Houston Showroom is excited to present this very nasty 1969 Plymouth Road Runner for sale. Introduced in 1968 as a trim level for the Plymouth Belvedere, the Road Runner was designed to be a "no frills" muscle car, just a simple car with a big engine. Trim-wise, it was fit between the highest trim GTX and the slightly lower trim-level Satellite. The Road Runner sold double its expected numbers in the first year, becoming a tremendous success! This Road Runner is painted a dark purple metalflake that's so dark it looks black under most lighting, so whenever you take it to your cruise meets, you'll want to bring some extra lights to shine on it to bring out that sparkle - it's quite something! There's even a slightly lighter purple ghost flame treatment around the blower opening in the hood, which really pops in bright light. The chrome trim has all been treated to the same paint, furthering the "midnight assassin" look of this gnarly street terrorizer. This Road Runner has taken the concept of "giant engine in a bare-bones performance car" a few steps further than the norm. For starters, this beast does have the largest displacement engine that could be had in a Mopar in 1969, but the massive 440 CID V8 (that sits mostly) under the hood has been punched out .030", filled with goodies, and topped with dual Holley 4BBL carbs, a giant BDS blower and an NOS plate nitrous system. The mill is equipped with ported and polished aluminum Edelbrock Performer RPM heads, a Callies forged crankshaft, Eagle connecting rods, Diamond pistons, and Clevite bearings. It's kept cool by a giant aluminum radiator with twin electric fans. Chromed long tube headers feed into the dual 4" exhaust, providing a very muscular sound. Although the supercharger is pushing 10psi of boost, neither we nor its owner know what the NOS system is jetted to (he's never used it), so getting an idea of what it's capable of putting down on the dyno will require some fiddling around with different NOS jets. However, let's just say that this bad boy is already putting down some serious torque where the massive 33X18.50-15LT M/T ET Street slicks meet the pavement. Behind the huge blower-topped 440 is a performance built 727 TorqueFlite 3-speed automatic transmission, which has a reverse manual valve body configuration: a great setup for those trips down the 1320, which this car has been built for. Out back, the Dana 60 rear has been filled with a set of 4.88:1 gears, so this baby's quick off the line when you drop the hammer! Drivers will immediately recognize the Line Lock switch and NOS buttons on the shifter, and may find themselves wanting to see "what this thing feels like at WOT a lot" (couldn't resist a little rhyme regarding the wide open throttle actuation of the NOS)...If the driver likes to be running WOT frequently, they'll be grateful for the Wilwood multi-piston calipers hiding behind the Weld Racing wheels up front; which, along with the heavy duty Mopar finned drums out back, help bring this brawling beast to a stop quickly. The front tires are 28X7.50-15LT M/T Sportsman skinnies, and with the huge M/T "cheater slicks" out back, go a long way toward providing that vintage late 1960's muscle car stance and overall look. Inside, the rear passenger area has been "reconfigured slightly", because with its tubbed back half and 8-point roll cage, there's no longer a rear seat! Instead, that area is now nicely carpeted and/or covered in black synthetic leather. In front, the buckets are done in black woven fabric with synthetic leather trim and are equipped with multi-point RJS Racing harnesses. The overhead console area contains all the necessary switches for starting this beast up and keeping it lit, and a full complement of AutoMeter gauges (tach, boost pressure, fuel pressure, oil pressure, volts, and water temp) help the driver monitor critical systems' status. Out back, a fully adjustable multi-link Chassis Engineering rear drag suspension helps this hulking B-body plant all that big 440's blown power to the ground and keep it pointed down the track. If you're looking for that classic 1960's era Mopar muscle car that has a little extra lagniappe, you've found it. Call our Houston showroom to make it yours! First Name Please provide a first name. Gateway Classic Cars of Tampa is proud to digitally present this gorgeous 1968 Chevrolet Camaro SS convertible. The consignor believes this beauty to be an original SS. However, for those in the know, that's not's easy to prove unless you have solid paperwork i.e. window sticker or build sheet. Chevrolet only made 2, 750 SS Camaro convertibles in 1968 so there aren't many real ones riding around today. What we do know is this is a factory"12467" V8 convertible from the start. Despite what some may say, GM Vins don't always tell you exactly what a car is or isn't in terms of coveted options. We can, however, see the Vin on the title also stamped on the front engine pad of the 350ci (Casting #3914678 L48 MU 295HP). Take a look underneath and you'll find the bullet proof 12 bolt rear diff. Depending on who you speak to, some say all SS cars had the famed rear diff while other experts say that may not be correct. You be the judge. The consignor has owned the car for over two decades and states it was fully restored in the 1990s just before he purchased it. He states it is not an original red car and has a box of receipts for the new owner. Before bringing the car to Gateway, the consigner had some front end work done and a new top installed. One thing is for sure, this '68 Camaro drives and looks great! Come and see this one for yourself at our Tampa location. First Name Please provide a first name. Last Name Please provide a last name. Gateway Classic Cars St. Louis Showroom is excited to digitally present this beautiful 1968 Pontiac GTO. A very well done restoration has brought this 1968 GTO clone back to a high quality driver, capable of handling everyday use. The period correct, Pontiac 400 V8 is topped off with an Edlebrock AVS2 carburetor and mated with an upgraded 5-speed manual transmission, running through an Eaton Posi-traction rear end, with 3.55 gears for better drivability and smoother ride. Everything combined brings a wonderful sound through the Flow Master dual exhaust. Covered in beautiful Daytona Sunset Orange, the GTO also features a new, power convertible top with new pistons for ease of operation. Definitely a head turner. Gateway Classic Cars of Charlotte is proud to digitally present this "1990 Jeep Wrangler Rat-Rod rig", custom built for SEMA in 2018. "Scrapyard JK" started as an idea with Rockstar Garage to blend a rat rod with a modern Jeep for SEMA 2018. Unlike other rat rods, Geoff wanted to keep this a true Jeep with four wheel drive. The result was a JK tub that was shortened and narrowed, custom roll cage, standalone engine swap, and giant 40" Mickey Thompson tires. Featured in the Yukon Gear and Axle booth, it was one of the most talked about Jeeps at SEMA! The JK features drivetrain upgrades including; R1 Concepts - Brakes, a 6.0L LS engine paired with a 4L80 Automatic Transmission, F250 Superduty Dana 60 Front Axle, Ford F250 10.5 Sterling Rear Axle, 5.38 Yukon Gears, Yukon Zip Lockers Front And Rear, 231 Transfer Case, Yukon Driveshafts. Custom exhaust, mufflers NOT included. Exterior modifications include; Modified Jeep Wrangler Tub - Narrowed 2", Height Shortened by 8", Custom Built Frame, Custom Roll Cage, Genright JK Corners, Genright Rear Bumper, Genright Fuel Cell, JCR Offroad Aluminum Half Doors, Bullet Liner Destroyer Gray Exterior Coating and Narrowed JL Grille. Interior modifications include; Bare Metal Bomber Custom Seats, Powertank 10 lb C02 Tank, Dual Viair Air Tanks, Viair Dual 480 Compressors, Custom RHD Conversion, PSC Steering Wheel, sPOD Bantam Switch System (Touch Screen). Suspension consists of; Custom Airlift Suspension, Custom 4 Link Rear Using Artec Industries Brackets, Currie Johnny Joints For 4 Link Rear, Pure Performance F250 4 Link Arms Front, Teraflex Falcon 3.3 Jeep Shocks Wheels & tires; 40x13.50x17 Mickey Thompson Baja MTZ are mounted on KMC Dually Wheels. Gateway Classic Cars of Tampa is proud to digitally present this beautiful Baldwin Motion tribute, 1968 Chevrolet Camaro. There's no clear number how many of the legendary first generation Baldwin Motion Camaro's were produced, which is why car enthusiasts place them into the "Unicorn, " category. Sure, you've heard of one, but have you ever seen one? If you're looking to purchase an authentic BM Camaro you'd better have seriously deep pockets as they can run into the hundreds of thousands. This killer '68 Camaro underwent a full rotisserie restoration about a decade ago and it still looks fresh. Although it's not a 427ci engine, it is a built 402ci bolted to a 4-speed transmission and backed by a 12-bolt rear differential. Power brakes and power steering make driving this beast a pleasure. The factory Corvette Bronze color, black vinyl top, and American Racing Torq-Thrust wheels were meant to be together. You have to see this car in the light! The big block "Stinger" hood, the column mounted Sun tach, and Lakewood ladder bars will transport you back to Woodward Avenue as you wait for the green light and the chance to let the '68 Shelby KR next to you know he just made a big mistake. Gateway classic cars of Detroit is proud to present this 1988 Chevrolet Camaro Iroc Z28. This isn't your average 350 Iroc. This one has a custom pro-built 568 Big Block "killer engine" with 800hp to the rear wheels! And that's without NOS! Although it does have a NOS fogger system, capable of a 150-500 shot, it has never been used. The 568ci is equipped with GM Performance super large oval port heads and valves, Victory titanium valves and locks, bronze guides, copper alloy seats, Lunati 4340 crank, Lunati roller cam and roller lifters, Harland sharp roller rockers, TRW 14.1 dome top pistons, hooker super comp headers, Arrowmotive 8 gallon fuel cell, built Demon carburetor, MSD pro billet distributor, MSD digital 6 plus coil, Big aluminum Northern radiator with a power master 155 amp alternator. All that power is mated to a Turbo 400 transmission that has been built with a JW reverse manual valve body, TCI 5500 race stall with anti balloon plate and a Hurst V-matic 2 shifter. In the rear we have Southside machine lift bars and a narrowed HD race 9in rear from Moser, 4.56 gears, 40 spline Moser axles, Billet pinion support, Moser billet pinion yoke, Billet Moroso U-joint girdles, with a custom 2000HP drive shaft! Putting down all that power down to a set of Crager one-off 3 piece wheels, with M/T street radials with rear disc brakes, custom K member and control arms with coil overs. Step inside this beast and you will find a 5-point safety harnesses for both driver and passenger on custom front seats, a 10 point cage, and 10 Autometer gauges to keep you busy with a memory tachometer. Don't let all that race stuff confuse or worry you as this is a street legal car and has a complete wiring harness, so that all the lights, turn signals, windows all work as they should. Features in the Camaro performers magazine, whether you plan on hitting the strip, or the street, this Tangelo Camaro will impress everyone, even if they can only hear it! Gateway Classic Cars of Tampa is proud to digitally present this beautiful 1969 Chevrolet Chevelle. Guys let's jump right in on this one. There are more SS Camaro's and Chevelle's today than ever produced. How is that possible? Because many are fake and some are very well done. In 1969, GM changed how and what VIN numbers disclosed. "13637" does NOT mean this Chevelle is or is not a true SS for the '69 models. At the bottom of the cowl tag you will find the mythical, "L." Depending on who you listen too, some Chevy guys state for 1969, this indicates an authentic Super Sport while others disagree. Look gents here's the bottom line, unless you have the original window sticker or build sheet there's no way to prove a '69 SS is genuine so buyer beware. The consignor believes it is, but we can't verify the claim. That said, let's stick to what we know. This is a true "65" Olympic Gold car with the correct black interior and when combined with a black vinyl top creates an eye catching combination. Under the hood you'll find legendary big block Chevy power (casting number 3989854 or 3939854 it's hard to tell). At some point, the powerplant has been in the hands of a machine shop as the vin number is missing from the front pad, so we don't know if this is the original engine. Out back, a 4speed transmission and 12-bolt rear differential work in harmony to put the power and torque to the ground. This is a very nice driver quality car, and not a trailer Queen, that's been well cared for. This one puts the muscle in muscle car. First Name Please provide a first name. Gateway Classic Cars Houston Showroom is excited to offer this tribute to the rare L89 1968 Chevrolet Corvette, presented in the stunning LeMans Blue exterior color. Regular Production Option (RPO) L89 first became available with the 1967 Corvette. What made the L89 special is that it added the competition heads from the all-aluminum L88 427, along with an aluminum intake topped by three 2-barrel carbs on the base L71 427 CID V8. The result was a very potent 435HP/460TQ (SAE NET) rating from the factory. Only 624 of the 1968 Corvette production were equipped with the rare factory aluminum head L89 RPO code option, so the likelihood you can nab a real one will be along the lines of finding a pin in a stack of needles. Consequently, going with a well done tribute is a popular route: you get the performance of the original, yet you don't have to worry about potentially damaging an original. This sleek Corvette absolutely embodies the spirit of the 1960s with its bold design and powerful performance capabilities. Under the hood lies the legendary 427 CID V8 engine, with its "tri deuce" carburetors and aluminum intake and heads, this bad boy promises an exhilarating driving experience. The big 427 sends all that power out back via its Muncie 4-Speed manual transmission to the 3.70:1 Posi-equipped rear end. If you aren't careful, you'll go through a lot of rear tires. Then again, that's half the fun of having one of these manual transmission big block Corvettes (well, for some of us)! Slip inside to discover a cabin that nicely complements the striking exterior. The black interior is designed with synthetic leather seating that balances comfort and heritage. Modern conveniences, such as power windows and power steering, enhance the driving experience while maintaining an authentic feel. The inclusion of 4-wheel power disc brakes underscores the focus on drivability and control, making every journey smooth and enjoyable. As for entertainment, the AM/FM radio provides a nod to period-correct audio while ensuring you have access to your favorite tunes. The exterior boasts hub caps and the classic redline bias ply tires, emphasizing the timeless aesthetic appeal of this Corvette. Safety features like seatbelts are thoughtfully included, rounding out the driving experience with practicality. The distinctive T-tops provide an open-air driving experience that lets you enjoy the thrill of the road to its fullest. Don't miss out on the opportunity to add a rare Corvette to your collection - call or email our Houston Showroom today! First Name Please provide a first name. Last Name Please provide a last name. engine: L-head 221 cubic inch V-8 engine. V8
description: Gateway Classic Cars of Scottsdale is pleased to present for sale, on consignment, a rare opportunity to pick up this beautiful 1940 Ford Deluxe Convertible! This car came from a large collection of which we hand picked several to consign with us. Truly a specimen, this car looks like it has sat in a time capsule for quite some time and is well preserved. Finished in Mandarin Maroon over Tan interior with a Tan top, this combo exudes style, class and sophistication. Under the hood you will find the L-Head 221 Cubic Inch V8 that is mated to a 3 speed "3 on the Tree" manual transmission. Much of the car is believed to be original and clearly loved and well looked after, considering it came off the production line 83 years ago! Finding a car like this that you can get in, fire up and make your way down the road to a show and take home a trophy is a rarity. This is a great opportunity for anyone looking for this type of car from an era where the automobile was designed as a work of art. Features are, AM Radio, Manual Convertible Top, Power Steering and Seat Belts. Contact our friendly sales staff today to learn more and thank you for looking! First Name Please provide a first name. Gateway Classic Cars San Antonio / Austin Showroom is excited to offer this 1968 Mercury Cougar for sale. Painted in a stunning black cherry red upper and candy red lower two tone exterior color, this car is sure to turn heads wherever it goes. The black comfort suede interior nicely complements the bold exterior, providing a comfortable and stylish ride. Under the hood, this Cougar is powered by a 302 CID V8 engine, which is equipped with a MSD Atomic EFI, MSD electronic ignition, and a high output alternator w/ internal regulator. Backing the potent 302 is a smooth Merc-O-Matic transmission. This Cougar also comes with front disc brakes and newly rebuilt drums in the rear, ensuring reliable, fade free stops. The suspension has been upgraded with new Eaton Detroit Speed lowering springs (2" rear and 1.5" in front) and new QA1 shocks with a front sway bar and strut tower brace for improved chassis stiffening. Also included is a Borgeson power steering conversion with pump cooler. This combination delivers a driving experience that is both powerful and refined, reminding you of the golden era of American automotive engineering combined with modern technology for durability and comfort. This 1968 Mercury Cougar is not just about looks and power, it's also equipped with features that ensure a comfortable and enjoyable ride. It comes with an air-conditioning system to keep you cool during the summer days. Entertainment is provided by an AM/FM radio with Bluetooth and new front speakers, so you can enjoy your favorite tunes while cruising down the road. This Cougar also features 17" Hot Rods by BOYD's Custom Wheels built to order and a tilt steering column with a snazzy wood-rimmed aluminum wheel for easy maneuverability and comfortable driving position. All in all, this 1968 Mercury Cougar offers a great blend of vintage charm, power, and comfort. Experience the glory days of American muscle cars with this classic beauty.
